Normally a large sized pho is big enough for me and my honey to share, but the bowl at Miss Saigon wasn't very large and didn't have enough noodles. I thought it was pretty pricey for $10. We also ordered the fried calamari but it wasn't crispy and battered enough.

We came with a party of 10 for dinner on a Saturday night. The restaurant was about half full, so not terribly busy, and there were about 4 servers who did not speak English very well. We placed our food and drink orders and the first thing that was brought out was a fresh coconut. 

The server said 'coconut' and we all looked at each other confused. Then my friend said he ordered fresh lemonade, but the server kept pushing the coconut on him. Confused, my friend asked if the coconut was inside the lemonade and the server just said 'coconut'. So we just took the coconut and asked for another lemonade. 

Then I decided to order a Thai tea. After it was brought out, a different server then asked if I ordered a Vietnamese coffee. We were not falling for that trap again!

The food arrived at staggered times, most people ordered a pho, two ordered a rice plate, and one person ordered a bun bo hue (#27). Half way through eating, item #27 did not yet arrive. We inquired about it and the server said it was on the way. When we were almost done eating, the dish still hadn't arrived! It's one of the worst feelings being the only one not eating when everyone around you is chowing down and then when you are the only one eating, you can't enjoy the food because you're too busy worrying about making everyone wait because the food came so late. 

Definitely not returning or recommending Miss SaiGon to anyone!
author: Adrienne K.

description: Pho Ga broth tasted like tap water with notes of meh chicken, no spices, no richness, so disappointing.   Delivery did not include any sauces, although requested.   Summer rolls were very small and not so fresh looking.  Garlic noodles tasted off and overly starchy.   Never again.
author: Kate R.

description:
Another addition to my pho places. Yummy food, clean, and friendly service. Had...
Filet mignon pho with tendons and imperial rolls...all good
author: Richard C.

description:
Ive been here 50+ times... so this review is way overdue.  

Food:   Always great.   5-Stars!!!   
Service:   Always friendly and with a smile!   5-Stars!  
Price:   Great Value!!!   5-Stars!
Location:   Don't let it scare you off!   
Bathrooms... its an old building... but they are clean and well maintained.  

The large size beef and ball pho... my favorite.   also the steak potatoes and garlic noodle dish is very hardy and supper yummy!     My wife lives the mixed seafood and pork Pho.     We go there at least once a month, and order it in every once in a while. 

They have a fun atmosphere and always are playing some funky and jazzy Thai or Vietnamese music and TV programs.    It's a clean place, and they always go out of the way to give you any extra sides of peanut sauce or spicy dips.
author: Vlad C.

description: First time eating at this restaurant and it was ok only. Perhaps I'm not from here ... but the food is not as good as Toronto. The Pho broth was not flavorful. I also ordered Hu Tieu Nam Vang and the wrong noodle was used. Again ... Maybe because I'm not from here hence my taste buds are not in line with the locals ... but this restaurant would not survive in Toronto.
author: Eric N.

description:
They're ahead of you every step of the way.
-already preempted our request for a split check 
-brought us two glasses for the iced coffee that two of us wanted to share 
-even preempted our request hoisin sauce

They even keep their pho ingredients nice and separate to go!

Tu Lan up the street is great if you want imperial rolls, but Miss Saigon is the hidden jewel of SoMa when it comes to authentic Vietnamese food.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Miss Saigon has some delicious food choices.  We tried the pho, papaya salad, egg rolls, shaking beef with garlic noodles and pork/egg roll vermicelli noodles.

The papaya salad's taste was brought out by the interesting pairing of beef jerky.

On the flip side, the pho, vermicelli, and egg rolls lacked a depth of flavor. The lack of savoriness really took a heavy hit on the pho.

All in all, this spot is definitely a great spot to check out.
author: Francisco D.

description:
Sitting in front of the kitchen, I just witnessed the dishwasher save vegetables from a previous tables dirty dishes and put them back into a tub where the server comes and grabs them with dirty hands(servers always have dirty hands) to serve to customers. Not even re-washed to say the least.

There was a used lime on one of the plates, he at least took that off and threw it away.

I am 100% certain on this. I checked when I walked by and there was absolutely no other place he could have put it.


So the pho I just ate more than likely had recycled bean sprouts, jalapeños, basil, and lime. Dope. I wonder how many peoples germs I have spinning around in my mouth.

I really hope the health department checks on this. Shame on the owners. 

I know this probably isn't the only restaurant that does this, but I didn't catch the others.
author: Rhiannon D.

description: Ordered the garlic noodles and pho. Ended up eating the pho the next day and it was still delicious. Great flavor to the broth and tasty fresh veggies.
author: Liz B.

description:
Miss Saigon was a disappointment since we came here because of the yelp ratings.

I ordered the #27 (bun bo hue) and it was just disappointing. Not authentic. The broth was full of msg and soup flavoring packet(??) and I could not taste the meat at all. The vegetables they gave me to add to the food is not what you're supposed to put in this dish. If you want good authentic Vietnamese food, I would recommend you go somewhere else.

My boyfriend ordered #29b (Hu tieu nam vang kho) and it was also a disappointment. It is not what it is suppose to be - they used the wrong noodles and the wrong sauce, which was overly sweet. 

Overall, it just wasn't a good meal for both of us :( the meat was decent but the flavoring was all wrong.
author: Alicia L.

description: Straight in the hood of Soma. The decor is off the hook!!! Lit up trees with like xmas lights and a fake fire place. I felt like i was really in Saigon lol. Only had the fried egg rolls and the catfish claypot. The fried egg rolls were bomb, catfish not so much but decent. Took a while for the food to come, but might of been because of the table of 10 next to us. I just need to go back and try some other items on the menu. I recommend the egg rolls!!!
author: Theresa M.

description: Ordered delivery. The packaging isn't useful for a full delivery experience;  a plastic bowl is not provided to mix the broth and ingredients in. They didn't include chili paste or Sriracha which other restaurants do, which I might have to explicitly ask for. The pho dish itself tasted bland and the broth wasn't hot enough to cook my beef.
author: Katie R.

description: Best Pho Tai (noodle soup with meat) in the city. The broth is flavorful and they give you good quality meat. It's in a sketchy area, but always worth a trip. Only negative comment is thatthe soup can sometimes be a bit too sweet for me, but that sometimes varies.
author: TravelingHungry ..

description:
Having a Vietnamese restaurant near my office seems to be a trend I've carried over from my days in NYC.

I've been here twice so far and always order the beef pho. Service here is quick with no frills. We get seated quickly, the food comes out quickly, and then we're back to work.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: We went there last night. The foods here so great. Specially the crab meat egg rolls is best. Service was awesome. Definitely will come back.
author: LL S.

description:
This spot offers a long list of items on their menu from spring rolls to pho which all looked amazing in the photos. Overall the food was good and the atmosphere was quirky (Xmas lights and random mannequin at the door) and made for a quick bite before our show, but the chicken in the garlic noodles was extremely dry and frankly, scant. 

I suppose this place works as a bargain lunch time thing? Or maybe I tried the wrong dishes? Regardless I'm curious to try the pho since it seems every other customer ordered THAT after I had already ordered my own dishes. Next time Miss Saigon.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
This is the best Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco.

Here's why:
The food here is authentic. Every dish has the nuance and complexity of traditional Vietnamese cuisine that you find on the streets of Saigon. They serve the best tasting version of Bún Bò Huê and Pho in San Francisco.
The decor is so over the top and Kitsch that it becomes Camp and delightfully entertaining.
The staff is very accommodating and courteous to your needs.
Clean bathrooms.
Discounts for local industry workers; just ask.
author: Thom N.

description: I ordered some takeout for delivery through Yelp. It was horrible. The noodles were all clumped up and the soup was cold. There was no way to heat the meat up with the cold soup. Plus I didn't get any utensils or napkins. I had to find my old fork.
author: Ran Z.

description: The mannequin scared me. The ppl outside scared me. There's this strange green lighting kinda creepy. 80s tunes in Vietnamese. They gave us hot water but the other tables ice water. I love this place. The filet mignon pho is spectacular. Made sure I drank all the soup. My mom walked 3 miles to eat here. 5 stars. 100/100. "I could eat here everyday"
author: S S.

description:
Love the noodles.

Hate the bathroom. The bathroom lid doesn't open. The soap dispenser doesn't dispense.

Also, the floor is always slippery, like they use dirty water to mop the floors. 

Wtf guys.

Food 12/10. Everything else 6/10.

Ps. The green lighting makes me feel like I'm eating my BBH on the deck of an alien spaceship.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Tried this pho restaurant because it was ranked as #1 on the Bold Italic's list of 11 best bowls of pho in San Francisco.

The area around it is pretty sketch so probably wouldn't walk here next time. The restaurant itself is clean, nicely decorated and the service was quick.

Ordered the thai iced tea with boba ($3.50) which was a little too sweet. I was recommended by friends to get the #17b pho with filet mignon so had to try that. The large was $11 and I finished all of it.

I actually think the brisket/flank I normally get is better in pho than filet mignon and cheaper. The broth is pretty different than other places I've been to. It's light and also very oily. The hoisin and sriracha sauce come in a little dish together.

Everyone's conclusion at our table was the pho is good but isn't anything extraordinary.
author: Linda X.

description: As yelp says, I am a regular. It's true! I am pretty much here every Friday...And for good reason. Miss SaiGon has not disappointed me once. Amazing food and customer service. They remember their regular customers like me. It's appreciated. This is a place I will continue to visit and you should too. Area around the restaurant is a little sketchy. Inside is really cute and decorated with different kids of string lights. I love it. Thank you Miss SaiGon for your amazing food and service.
author: Nick R.

description:
Pretty disappointed with this place, despite the decent reviews.
I thought the food just wasn't that good. Looks very authentic inside, with lots of locals it seems. I had the summer rolls for starters and a chicken stir fry dish oyster sauce and rice for main course. The quality of meet was very poor with the chicken being quite rubbery. Also both courses arrived at the same time which is always frustrating. 
Service is ok which is the only redeeming feature!!
author: Derek M.

description: The most delicious fresh summer rolls that I've had in SF.  Look past the slightly crummy neighborhood for inexpensive, delicious Vietnamese food.
author: Aimee Y.

description:
The filet mignon pho is superb, and is offered in small and large servings. The small is perfectly sized for a weekday lunch when you shouldn't be caught nodding off at an afternoon meeting.

The meatball pho is also excellent. Beyond these two entrees, I've made no progress in exploring their extensive menu. It may be awhile before I consider looking at other options.

Word of caution -- don't let the mannequin greeter scare you off.
author: Mutant O.

description:
Super solid pho downtown. It's a bit of a walk if you work in the FiDi, however it's worth the treck. I ordered the rare beef pho which was delicious. Prices were solid, but obviously not your standard $7 bowls (cause it's more downtown).

My friend got the curry rice plate and really enjoyed it!
author: Cole S.

description: Yum. We will return again and again for the delicious pho. The service is prompt, the food is so good and the cost is reasonable. One of my favorite restaurants, just for the level of satisfaction I've felt after every meal.
author: Evan M.

description:
Don't let the neighborhood deter you. From the outside it looks like another beat up building on 6th street. When you walk in, expect to see a room packed full of lunch friends slurping on savory soups. The restaurant is on the corner of Mission and 6th street, not in between Minna and Market. I passed it 3 times looking for it in between Minna & Market. 

For under $10.00 the vegetable soup is packed with roasted garlic & jalapeños , sautéed green onion and an assortment of sliced zig-zag shaped carrots, zucchini, broccoli, bok choy and tofu.  There's even a nice little wedge of lime to spritz your soup when you're ready to mix. The only change I would make would be to cut the broccoli into bite size pieces. Otherwise it was exactly the flavor I was craving. If you're short on time and coming for lunch, you can expect to wait about 10 minutes for the soup. They package the noodles and vegetables separate from the broth. Not only does it make transport easy, it also allows you to control the portion of veggie/broth ratio. 

Miss SaiGon has an extensive menu and based on the crowd I saw inside, I'd bet there are many other options just as good as my soup. I'll just have to mosey on back over.
author: Jaylena P.

description: This place is awesome! I ordered the garlic noodle with chicken and it was very tasty! On time delivery!  It's nice to know good places like this deliveries to the FiDi since I'm usually super busy and hate wasting my time going out for lunch.  My $20 lunch (includes tax and $4 tips for making my life easy) well worth it.
author: Camille K.

description: Was not feeling well and wanted some nice, comforting Pho. I ordered from Miss Saigon via Postmates but they brought the complete wrong order. Disappointment was an understatement. But the nice folks at Miss SaiGon delivered the correct order themselves which was super kind. Tasty white meat chicken pho, crispy fried pork rolls and broken rice with lemongrass pork. So appreciative! Thanks Miss SaiGon!
author: Hayley S.

description: I arrived at miss saigon ready to eat dinner. I ordered my food with my friend and a couple comes in next to us 20 minutes later, orders, and gets their food before we did. We sat there for 10 more minutes thinking our food would arrive and still nothing. We asked for our food and all they kept saying was "it's coming". Worst experience i had.
author: Miguel C.

description: Top 3 pho in the city. Consistently great.  Imperial rolls good too. No reason to order anything else on the menu.
author: Lauren J.

description: Literally my only complaint is that I burned my tongue because I couldn't chill till it cooled as it smelled so delicious. This is 100% my fault and I have minimal regrets.
author: Kaia R.

description: Delicious, authentic Vietnamese food. Wonderful service! We even visited with the owners and the people who worked there. Loved this place!
author: Michelle N.

description:
To update my review from my following visit (because i'm a good person so i figured i'd give them the benefit of the doubt) 

FOOD POISONING. Thank you Miss Saigon, you've officially made me scared to eat the food of my people.

I decided to search up their health score online (San francisco Department of Public Health) and behind the 4 star yelp score to my surprise, the dangerously low score of 54. 

Make sure you know what you're getting yourself into when you go to a hole in the wall place.




17-Dec-2014       Inspection Type: Routine - Unscheduled           Score: 54

Inadequate food safety knowledge or lack of certified food safety manager Moderate Risk -

Inadequate and inaccessible handwashing facilities Moderate Risk -

Inadequate procedures or records for time as a public health control Moderate Risk 
18-DEC-14
Unclean nonfood contact surfaces Low Risk -

Unapproved or unmaintained equipment or utensils Low Risk -

Low risk vermin infestation Low Risk 18-DEC-14

Improper cooling methods High Risk 18-DEC-14

Sewage or wastewater contamination High Risk 18-DEC-14

High risk food holding temperature High Risk 18-DEC-14

Unclean hands or improper use of gloves High Risk 18-DEC-14
author: Anh T.

description: This is the first pho restaurant I've been to in the city that I genuinely like and find authentic. We ordered the 17b pho tai mem (filet mignon pho). The broth was fatty and flavorful. The noodle was chewy and tasty. Pho noodle can get soggy but that was not the case with the noodle here. The crown jewel, however, was the beef, which melted in my mouth at first bite. I am looking forward to coming back to this place for more tasty pho in the future!
author: Catherine T.

description: I live close by so I go to Miss Saigon frequently for the pho. What I really like about Miss Saigon is they're super efficient, and you tend to get your food very quickly if you're dining in. I can't recommend getting pho for takeout though as the broth is not hot enough to cook the meat without some reheating, but this is probably an issue at other Vietmanese places as well.
author: Austin W.

description: Today was the second time we came here for pho.We had first discovered this spot on yelp by just searching for best pho. The reviews  about the pho are pretty much spot on.  The filet mignon pho is absolutely delicious. Friendly service and clean dining area. I liked the ambiance too. Lots of pretty paintings and nice decor.Dropped one star because I don't like the location. Lots of homeless and sketchy people/activities all over the place in the general area of the restaurant. Also parking is not easy. Luckily both times we were able to get parking on the street right in front of the restaurant. No charge for metered parking on Sunday.
author: K K.

description: This place is great! The cream cheese wontons are incredible I could live off of them. The atmosphere is nothing special, looks like your average Asian restaurant. The pho has more noodles than broth which isn't the ideal ratio. It's quick and well priced so if you are just going for the food I'd recommend.
author: Emily L.

description: The food is wonderful. The ambiance is a bit old fashioned, but well worth the visit.
author: Alessandra C.

description: Still at the pho tasting gig.....and the filet mignon pho here is hands down the best I have found on both sides of the Bay. The meat in pho is generally its weak sister-but not the filet mignon version at Miss Saigon. Top notch!
author: Laurence T.

description: One of my favorite pho places in the area, and definitely my favorite in sf. I always order the popular filet minion pho, which takes the broth to a whole different level! My only complaint is that the portions seem to be getting smaller and smaller, you get a lot of soup which is great, however the amount of noodles they give you is clearly not enough. When I first came here with my dad, the portions used to be so big, I would get full without a problem. Given my big appetite, the portions were more than enough for other people. I always have to order extra noodles here, and sometimes that isn't enough. The service here however is extraordinary, the owner especially will go out of his way and make sure you're satisfied. You definitely don't see kind of service at a Vietnamese restaurant all the time.
author: Cheryn L.

description: A bit sketchy on the outside but don't let that discourage you from going in, they have great banh mi sandwiches and all options of vietnamese soup!
author: Calvin C.

description: Been ordering from here few times via Eat24. Grilled pork with vermicelli(yummy fish sauce), goi cuon without peanut in sauce please, chicken salad, and grilled pork banh mi. Ahhhh, luv Vietnamese food!
author: Vee V.

description: DO NOT order their spring rolls! I honestly don't know how you can call yourself a Viet restaurant but your spring rolls suck. BUT their vermicelli bowls were pretty good. Their pork has a really nice BBQ flavor that most restaurants lack.
author: Raeann L.

description: Legit Vietnamese food!  Placed an order for delivery through Postmates and the food arrived extremely quickly and everything exceeded my expectations.  Ordered #3 Cha gio, #20 Pho dac biet, and #32 Bun thit nuong cha gio.  The egg roll was pretty good!  The wrapper was a bit denser than what I'd normally like, but the filling was on point.  I was really surprised with the pho.  The broth actually had flavor, and they are very generous with the beef portions.  Bit pricey in general, but can't really complain too much for SoMa.  Would definitely order again.
author: William L.

description: The Pho with Filet Mingnon. There is not enough words to describe the epic-ness of this pho. Hands down the best pho I have had to date. Yes the street outside may be sketch. But also YES - worth it. The staff was also super kind and accommodating. If you are a pho connoisseur this is an SF must!
author: Hannah C.

description:
It's an essential spot for food in downtown SF. Sometimes it is a four star restaurant because it is one of the better and still reasonably priced Asian food in downtown. And at times, it is a three star because the service and food isn't extraordinary yet.

Pho is good here as are specialty drinks like iced Vietnamese coffee. The spice and fresh veggie and meat slices are decent for the pho. The soup isn't the hottest so you may want to put the veggie and spice in then quickly turn the noodles and set them on top of the raw stuff - helps heat things up.

The waiters can be nice when you ask for extra spice, sriracha and basil leaves

On some lucky days if you ask for boba tea, they actually might just have it. it isn't like Gong Cha, Tea Era or Fantasia but it maybe slightly better than Quickly and may just be the best in downtown (because boba really isn't available around here - only recently with the exception of Boba Guys which kickstarter fund raised and opened in Union Square)
author: Dilys S.

description:
I stressed how much I love tripe and they literally put a big handful of tripe in my bowl. A different server came by halfway through the meal to make sure I had enough tripe. CAN THIS PLACE GET ANY BETTER??

Service can be slow during the lunch rush but it's not ground-shattering bad. Food was good and portion was REALLY good for the price. The small is $9 but the large is just a dollar more for a much larger bowl.

I love the atmosphere here. The staff is attentive and nice. It's a casual setting but noise doesn't drown out my own conversations.
author: Lani C.

description:
If you can get past the creepy mannequin in the front without a little shriek I commend you. I've been here three times already but it gets me every time.

I got the bun vermicelli with pork, and it was nothing to sneeze at let me tell you. The pork was really well seasoned, the noodles were nice and soft. The pho is decent. It's good for a quick bite!
author: Rosy H.

description:
Pho dac biet, the portions fine, the meat portion was adequate, no frills and no problems here...

They have che ba mau here and it comes in a largee wine glass, what a nice touch haha....

Theyve got a pretty decent selection of foods you would want for a viet sit down...but i have yet to see how their bun bo hue or bun rieu is...

Careful with some of their dishes  that are not on the pho or bun bo hue section may cost more than places you can go to elsewhere in the bay area...

This place doesnt have too much that really stands out, compared to the pho places on jones and larkin.. id say this restaraunt is not even 3rd string on the list....

But its good if u wanna avoid crowds
author: Eric C.

description:
Yes, this is my go-to Vietnamese place in the city.

I've been going to Miss Saigon for the last few years, and it never disappoints. Especially when I'm homesick and missing my mom's homemade Vietnamese cooking, you know homegirl will be running here with an appetite.

While Miss Saigon is not exactly your hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese restaurant, it's also not your ritzy, fusion Vietnamese place either. It's kind of an in between place that's clean, consistent, authentic, and has good service. While the restaurant tends to be decently packed, I've never had to wait in line. I do need to commend Miss Saigon on their A+ effort to keep their restaurant well-decorated, especially during Christmas time, when they go all-out with winter decorations, making the ambiance super cozy and seasonal. I've had the Banh Xeo (Vietnamese Pancake), Pho (Noodle Soup), Bun (Vermicelli dish), Goi Du Du (Green Papaya Salad), Cha Gio Do Bien (Imperial Rolls), Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls), Cafe Sua Da (Vietnamese Iced Coffee). For the Banh Xeo and Cha Gio dishes, I generally have to ask for more lettuce, which the waiter is always super nice about replenishing (since you have to eat both the authentic way, using lettuce as a wrap before dipping in the fish sauce)! 

Also, I usually come with my sister or her roommate, who comes pretty regularly, enough that the servers/owner recognizes him and always brings out a huge Che (Vietnamese coconut milk dessert) to share, on the house. I've never left Miss Saigon disappointed (besides the times I don't go with my sister's roommate and don't get the complementary dessert). 

I'll surely be back again when I'm craving Vietnamese food.
author: Christine T.

description:
Miss SaiGon is typically listed in the media as among the "Best of" pho in San Francisco; mainly due to their filet mignon pho.  This place is usually packed.  Don't believe the hype.

First of all, I hate hate hate hate restaurants that charge you an arm and a leg only to skim on the ingredients.  Their filet mignon pho consists of a few pieces of meat and then a few sticks of noodle.  Seriously, I don't think it can fill up my six-yr-old nephew.  

Second, let's talk about the pho - is it good?  Sure.  But is it the best?  Not close.  It's basically your standard pho broth with filet mignon in a very tiny portion but charges a premium.

Unless you're on a diet, stay away.
.
If you want good pho, go to Pho Dong Huong on Monterey Blvd.
author: Uncle L.

description:
Looking at the restaurant outside I was expecting there wouldn't be as much customers. Because of a few reasons, the area is pretty sketchy. Not much business people would be working in this area. 

Oh boy, was I wrong when I walked in especially during lunch. The wait was 10 minutes for me because I was eating by myself. I noticed the whole restaurant was packed with people who worked around the area. 

The customer service at the beginning was pretty bad, but I don't blame them because they have to serve the customers at the tables so they can turnover tables quicker. 

When I was seated, I spoke Vietnamese and asked what was the best soup the waiter recommended. He said bun bo hue. I chose that and I also ordered a thai dessert (Che). My bun Bo hue came out pretty quickly with veggies on the side. It was delicious, flavorful, great amount spiciness to it and had tons of meat. Even one of the waiters stopped by to ask if it was spicy enough for me and if I wanted more spicy sauce. I have never been asked that at any Vietnamese restaurants about the spice level so that's definitely a plus. And I have high standards for bun Bo hue. 

It was also good customer service when a sweet old waiter stopped by to ask if I enjoyed my bun Bo hue to my liking when I was done with my soup. 

However, my Che thai took awhile. They were super busy serving other tables. I was patient enough to wait for it while eating my bun Bo hue. Waiter #1 was able to tell waiter #2 that my table needs Che thai now. So, they were able to notice that I was missing my drink without telling me, which is good. The Che was pretty mediocre. 

I'll be back for the bomb bun Bo hue!!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Bottom line: Best pho in the hood for cheap...

I get a combo bowl in here almost weekly, I live nearby  and will only venture to Turtle Tower if I wake up too late for Dottie's but too early for Miss Saigon on the weekends. 

Great broth, fresh vegetables (that I don't eat), and their beef is always CRACK. I can't really speak to the other menu items, but why would you get anything else?! HAVE FAITH AND JUST GET A COMBO BOWL, YOU WILL LOVE ME AFTER! If you think it needs more flavor, be a meng and pound the red rooster.

The servers are from the mother land, do not be alarmed if they come off almost "too friendly". These guys are awesome, and if you come enough your meat portions definitely show signs of loyalty bonuses!
author: Roger L.

description: They had an article about the best places to get pho on a rainy day which we never had for a long time but once in a while you would come here just because outside look so ugly and cold that you need pho HAHA. Best place to have pho when finish movies at AMC on 4th St. I always get the 11b which is filet mignon pho. The meat is tender, it gives the soup a rich flavor. Nowhere else around San Francisco have filet mignon pho but here.
author: Nick F.

description:
Great Vietnamese food! Just be aware that if you decide to make the trek here, the surrounding area is pretty sketchy so would recommend taking a Lyft / Uber unless it's during the day.

Everything we ordered was delicious. We got the imperial rolls with crab and shrimp which were nicely fried and full of flavor. For entrees, we both got a large bowl of pho which was amongst one of the best bowls of pho I've had. My one gripe was that my broth base was oilier than I would expect for pho, but it tasted good nevertheless. Decor is pretty wild (there's a huge woman statue at the front of the restaurant, the ceilings are painted of clouds, and a random fireplace in the back of the restaurant).

Overall, highly recommend :)
author: Claudia C.

description: 4 stars for food, 5 for service. The employees were incredibly nice. Both my mom and I got vegetable pho. Lots of veggies. Only 4 stars because it was a tad salty.
author: Marisa B.

description: I've been meaning to review this place for a long time - which goes to show how I've been taking it for granted! Wonderful nook in the heart of mid-Market/ SOMA with a very homely feel. The staff are gracious and food is delicious. Though 6th St is a bit scary, having a big bowl of pho will warm you up. Great for solo dining or groups - it's roomy and they play cute instrumental renditions of classical/romantic music, haha. Interior decor is pretty interesting too. Sometimes the waiters will give you free dessert in the evening! And best of all this place won't break the bank, yet the food is really good. Go visit soon and often!
author: Rosanna C.

description:
Let me start by saying that the broth at Miss SaiGon is DELICIOUS. 
Came on a Saturday night and the place was relatively empty. Opted for the combo pho, and was not disappointed!
The #3 egg rolls were a great appetizer to our meal. It comes with lettuce and fresh herbs, which really lightened up the heavy roll.

Cheap wine and beer to go with your pho as well.
author: Michelle L.

description: Wow, I didn't know I had already reviewed this place in the past! However, I turned vegan almost a year ago and coming back here, I wasn't sure there was anything I could eat. Lo and behold, they have Vegan Shaken Beef!! I tried it and it was super delicious! Got it with a side a rice. They had some other vegan items with vegan chicken, vegan shrimp and vegan fish but I haven't tried them yet because this particular one is so good! I honestly don't even think anyone would know it wasn't a cow when they taste it. Can't wait to go back. The service can get slow sometimes but hey, go with friends and talk to each other. Makes the time go by faster. I think I will start posting all the amazing vegan items I have found at different restaurants. Yelp seriously needs a Vegan tab.
author: Ava T.

description: My go to place. Poor deco but good food, good service, authentic people. I am not only the regular in store but also pick up through ordering on Yelp too. Combination pho, Bun Thit Nuong, spring roll and taro coconut rice dessert are my must order dishes. Reasonable price. But be careful on the neighborhood - not in a very safe area.
author: Anya C.

description:
I now understand why my SF friends prefer to get pho in Oakland instead of having me meet them out there. There really isn't any good places for pho in the city, sadly. 

Slowest pho restaurant ever! Took over 30 minutes for food to come. Don't come here if you're on a tight schedule. It didn't help that we were seated downstairs in the dungeon with poor ventilation while we waited for our food.

Soup was below average, and at $10 a bowl, I expected more for what I was paying for.

What grossed me out was how oily the broth was! I couldn't even enjoy the soup because it was unsettling looking at how much was oil was floating on top of the bowl. 

TIP: You're better off crossing the bridge for some real pho. I'll show you where all the good spots are! ;)
author: Ivana Y.

description:
Got the beef ball pho but instead of pho, got the vermicelli in replacement. Not a fan of the vermicelli....different from the normal vermicelli I have, cooked too soft and soggy. The soup base was good and the beef balls were on point but the noodles, which were the main aspect of the order was just not doing it for me...

Most likely won't be back.
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Plus point that made me write a comment today after a fee years coming here was because I saw the owner gave away food to a man who appeared to be in bad shape--physically and mentally. Tears!! I admire the work ethic and the heart that this place has. If you're in the neighborhood then supports them!

And also regular customers will have free dessert guarantee ;) when the owner sees you, and he always at the restaurant. Great food, cozy atmosphere with oldies Vietnamese playing mostly...and the staffs are as sweet as they can be. I don't remember waiting long for food for the past 5 years I've started coming here.
author: Wendy N.

description: Don't let 6th street fool you!! There's some really good food spots in this neighborhood and Miss Saigon is one of them.  I was told about this spot and decided to stop by for a bowl of pho. Whenever my time of the month hits, this is the one cure that comforts me.  I'll definitely be coming back
author: Crystal B.

description:
As a part Vietnamese, I always enjoys authentic Vietnamese food and this place did not disappoint! I ordered the Pho Dac Biet (Pho with different types of meats) and it was perfect, with ample broth, noodles and good quality meat. My fiance and Vietnamese mom ordered the #32 Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio (Vermicelli with grilled pork, egg rolls, lettuce, cucumber, and bean sprouts) which was the best they had ever had in the US. 

Also, wait staff is really friendly and the business appears to be run by a nice family, which makes the experience all the more intimate and better.
author: Andrea J.

description:
This is a clean, quiet hole-in-the-wall tucked away in SoMa that serves solid vietnamese food, although at a higher price than if you were to head over to the Tenderloin.

Their vermicelli bowl with grilled pork and fried egg roll was fairly standard fare, and was somewhere in the $9-$11 range. 

I read about their dry pho being amazing, so I had to try this as well. It's decent, but they premix the sauce into the noodles, unlike the famous ha nam ninh dry pho, and it just doesn't hit the spot that ha nam ninh does. Winner: Ha nam ninh.

If you're in this part of SoMa and you're craving vietnamese food, this isn't a bad option. It does the job, gets quite busy, and hits the spot.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Minus 2 stars for arguing with me about what I ordered.

I ordered the beef and egg roll over cold noodles, and they just gave me beef over cold noodles.

Where is the egg roll?

The waiter said I didn't order it, and said if I wanted the egg roll I would have to order the whole appetizer.

WHAT?!?

Then my friend ordered the beef stew noodle soup and a hot the and they forgot her tea. 

They never did bring her the tea..and had to strike it from the bill.

REALLY?

Don't make me come back here, 'cause I'd rather grab a pizza then go back to a place that has such poor customer service.
author: Jack R.

description: Great price for the food. The place was however cafeteria like and could be a little cleaner.  I was seated at 4pm, it wasn't too busy at all. Had only a couple tables with ppl. I had to flag down a waiter to bring me the menu. Could be more attentive to your customers when you have 3-4 staff on duty. ..
author: Jun Li Z.

description:
A more upscale Vietnamese restaurant that I am used to :) Service is better, they don't want you to hurry up and leave, they want you to have a nice pleasant experience. The place is more modern than typical, and they play songs that you'd hear on the radio. Although the "Bob the Builder" was playing on the T.V. screen; but maybe that was to accommodate my younger brothers. 

Food was really good, I went with my family of 5 so we were able to try a variety of things.

 -BUN BO HUE (beef noodle soup) was very flavorful with tender meat
 -GARLIC NOODLES AND PRAWNS - excellent dish. Amazing chow-mein-like noodles stir fried in garlic. Big plump prawns had a nice crunchy texture with the right amount of (sea) salt.
 -GARLIC NOODLES AND SHAKEN CUBED BEEF was super tender and juicy, filled with flavor as well. The noodles are the same as mentioned above. 
 -RICE AND KOREAN BBQ SHORT RIBS was good. Short ribs were cooked to perfection, but was very fatty (of course). 
 -Vermicelli noodles with beef and fish sauce was pretty good. No complaints there. 
 -SPRING ROLLS seemed smaller than usual. I didn't understand what was so great about it, but to each their own. 
-THAI DESSERT was yummy, tastes just as good here as it does at other restaurants. 

I would highly recommend this place and most definitely recommend the two dishes with garlic noodles that we ordered. I'm sure the other entrees with garlic noodles would be just as good :)
author: Helen H.

description: Bumped up a star for the banh mi.  I like that they have banh xeo, dine in is probably better... My take out crepe was soggy but still tasted pretty good.
author: Lyn C.

description:
After participating at the Batkid thing at union square, my roommate and I wandered over here. It was fairly quiet. 

We entered and were seated immediately. We were served water with cucumbers in them, and given menus. It was a cold day, so I decided to get pho. My roommate got the egg pancake.

This is one of the few places that serve beef balls with rare steak! Score. That's what I ordered. It came out piping hot, and I quickly put the sprouts, basil, and jalapenos in. There were a good amount of noodles and the broth was very tasty!

Some side notes:
- The service was pretty good. Our waiter was super nice and accommodating. He always smiled. He came over to provide us with anything we needed.
- They don't keep stuff at the table... no siracha, no towers of spoons and sauce bowls, no bucket of chopsticks.
- Siracha is provided in a sauce bowl with the hoisen sauce. Our server asked if we would like a bottle at the table. At first I declined, but then I ran out, so I asked for it.
- Prices are very neutral, about the same as any pho you'd get in SF.

It's not thanksgiving yet, but they had TVs on... playing christmas songs with music videos. The music videos were mormon based videos, and inbetween songs, it would advertise (visually, not audibly) the church of latter day saints... okay.

Anyway, service was good, and the pho was delicious. If I get the chance to stop by again, I definitely will!
author: Kaje Y.

description:
One of my go-to places in the area for Vietnamese food.

I don't typically get anything other than pho, noodle bowls, or the rolls and they have never disappointed. I default to Miss Saigon whenever I am in need of some food.

What is notable about Miss Saigon, and I don't see a lot of others talking about it, is that they have a pretty sizable Vietnamese desserts menu that most other restaurants just don't have and that's what I come here for. Their desserts are mostly under $5 and they are all huge servings---so if you've got a craving for rice/tapioca-based Asian desserts, Miss Saigon is a great place to go.
author: Yan F.

description:
FOOD:
This place is not great. Pho is not that good here. My boyfriend got the Bun Bo Hue and the spices in it were not flavorful enough.

SERVICE:
Your food will take FOREVER to come. The waiter got our order wrong.

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? NO
author: Kelley Y.

description: Was in the area and had a strong craving for some pho so I tried it out with my friend. Quite place with only a couple customers and a cute ambiance. The pho was delicious but shortly after finishing my meal I noticed a black shadow cross the floor. I didn't think anything of it until I looked at the floor again only to see a mouse. One of the waiters noticed my shocked face but was surprisingly cavalier about having a rodent in the restaurant. Maybe this is typical downtown? I asked for the check immediately and left. I really liked the food and was thinking about making it my new pho location, but I honestly don't think I can ever go back.
author: Cassandra A.

description:
Egg roll was good, but the BBH and other noodle were too sweet. Communication is a challenge here. 

We won't come back.  It's not for us.
author: Che K.

description:
I'd give this place a 3.5
The pho was way better than I expected, but to be honest, I wasn't expecting much.
It may be the best pho I've had in this city but I haven't been too impressed by the pho in SF...
The portions are pretty LARGE. I think it's probably safe sharing one bowl between two friends. If I'm craving pho, I'll probably find myself back here before looking up other places in the city.
author: Michelle K.

description: This place does not disappoint. I of course ordered the 17b, like everyone else has suggested. Extremely tasty broth with the filet mignon cooked just right, and the noodles were the perfect texture. The broth is on the oily side though, you can definitely see all the oil bubbles when they set down the bowl. Suggestion - come before 11:45am, as it gets pretty packed with the lunch crowd.
author: Minette C.

description:
Generally speaking, hole in the wall restaurants that have decent ratings such as this place have really good food; not this place.
Everybody has a different taste when it comes to pho; this was not my taste.
The soup base was very greasy and it tasted very salty. I felt like I was eating lard. The Filet Mignon tasted a little funky. The noodles had a weird texture I'm not used to.
The one thing that tasted great was the pork egg rolls, all 2 of them (in LA we get 4 for this price). 
Miss Saigon really MISSed the spot.
author: Eugene P.

description: Incredibly flavorful broth in their beef pho, quality of the meat is exceptional, reasonable prices and in a convenient location.  What more could you want?
author: Janis C.

description: This review is based on a delivery order.  I ordered a "large" Pho.  The delivery was fast, the broth tasted ok, but it came in a regular size container (not large) and it was about 3/4 full.  The rest of the ingredients tasted ok too, but they were skimpy with those too.  Overall it was overpriced for both the quality and the portion size.
author: T. B.

description: The Banh Mi was one of the best I've ever tried, the use of spice and coriander worked so well together to create an amazing taste. The pork inside the Banh Mi was phenomenal, and just so delicious that I know I'll be coming back.
author: Boubeth A.

description: This place has delicious Pho - really good flavorful broth, reasonable prices, and all the traditional fixings on the side. I've tried Pho several places in Vietnam, and I'm mostly used to the Pho in SJ and this is definitely top notch. This place deserves 4/5 at the very least. The restaurant itself is cozy, but I've mostly ordered delivery pho and also have the best experience delivery - they are very generous with portions and include all of the sides to add to your pho whereas other places skimp on that, or don't always include them and have inferior broth. Good job Miss Saigon, I am a regular now.
author: Pratul L.

description:
Came here after a meeting and was hungry. Quickly ordered and waited. This was the 1st place that took 15 mins to make a bowl of Pho. I wondered why the water tasted funny even with a cucumber, until I seen the waiter pour a glass back into the pitcher they were refilling our glasses with.

When arrived it was a disappointment. The bowl was said to be a large but almost identical to a medium. The proteins were mainly cheap beef balls and almost nothing of any other meat and even very limited on noodles which should be the cheapest of them all.
author: M C.

description:
Pretty standard Vietnamese restaurant. Don't really see why everyone has got their socks in a bunch for this spot. It was super usual.

I just ordered the bun. Definitely up to standards, but nothing special at all. Meat was tasty and tender, and everything else seemed to be pretty fresh. 

The restaurant itself was alright. Kind of dark in there to be honest. Like they had their lights set on the dimmest setting for some reason. Also, it really isn't in the best of neighborhoods. We parked like a block or two away and I'm surprised we didn't get mugged walking to and from the shop. 

Anyways, just another average Vietnamese restaurant. Nothing more, nothing less.
author: Sean H.

description:
Being a SoCal native, I grew up surrounded by some pretty decent pho restaurants. I was lucky that this restaurant was nearby my apartment. Their broth isn't too oily,  and the meat was tender every time I went. I would always order the Pho Tai with filet mignon. Fast service, decent pho = perfect hangover remedy.

I just wish they would open earlier in the morning, and not at noon every day. Wishful thinking!
author: Daniel Y.

description: Very good quality food, the pho was really good & so was the pancake & the food was delivered early. I'm from Australia on holidays but if I was living here Miss SaiGon would be a regular takeaway for me.
author: Andrew J.

description: I go here once a year just because it's close by and decent. The pho is good enough to satisfy your pho cravings, but not super delicious. Don't get the bun rieu here. I should've listened to the other reviews. I'm used to bun rieu brimming with soft chunks of that crab and shrimp stuff, fried tofu, tomatoes, and pork blood. The bun rieu here had a few pieces of tomato, fake crab, and weird solid chunks of shrimp and crab stuff. The broth was a bit too clear and tasted close to bun rieu broth, but not quite. The servers have always been nice.
author: Ai N.

description: We stopped by about a week ago. My husband  had Pho Ga and Pho Bo. Both were so damn good! This is our second favorite place in the neighborhood. Food is good, restaurant feels like you are in Vietnam. Neighborhood is the TL so don't mind the crackheads.
author: Susan S.

description:
THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD!!

Plenty of metered parking in this busy part of town, sort of sketchy, but not that bad. Found this place through searching pho on yelp in San Francisco, and saw high reviews and wanted to check it out. Once again, Yelp and yelpers have not failed me :) This place is dimly lit, creating a cozy atmosphere. There was a mannequin at the entrance right as you walk in, it is so creepy! The menu had photos of many of the items, which helped a lot (I like visuals menus). 

We had ice water with a slice of cucumber to start. My party of 3 each ordered a dinner item consisting of Bun bo hue, Hu tieu nam vang, 2x of Mu toi bo luc lac. Everyone enjoyed their dish! I didn't try it, but the bun bo hue wasn't too spicy, a good amount. The Mu toi bo luc lac which is the shaken beef chunks with garlic noodle were good said by both the guys. I chose the Hu tieu nam vang (rice noodles with pork, shrimp, crab stick and quail eggs) because I never tried seafood nor quail eggs in my pho before but was so intrigued! The dish came out with the noodles being sort of hard, but after a little longer of soaking, it was softer. I couldn't stop eating to talk to the people at my table haha. The broth was delicious!!!!! I had my handful of pho in my lifetime, but this has to be the best pho I've ever had! The price was a little steep for pho, but it's so worth it!

They also serve Tiger beer.

I recommend this place to anyone! Anything on the menu, because they all sound really good :]
author: Winnie T.

description: With reading the previous reviews, I would have to concur this restaurant should not be one that you dine in at a later hour. The primary reason i'm giving such a poor was the lack of service.  I really wanted just a bowl of pho with prawns.  With that not being an option, I went with Bun rieu.  With being in the city I thought I should try something new.  The noodles tasted like rotten fish, as well as all of the dishes components.  I hate to be mean, but this was the first meal I wanted to walk out on within first bite.  There are probably other good things to be ordered on the menu.  Unfortunately, I was never asked how the dish was.  I would have just asked to place an additional order to go (paid for both of course) with leaving that behind.  The server never asked once if I enjoyed my meal, because I could have said no and spent that time ordering something more accordingly.  Instead just dropped the check within two minutes and carried on.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
I'm always looking for a great authentic Vietnamese restaurant in the area and I found one nearby work today. Yay! 

A coworker and I have agreed to explore the literally crazy Tenderloins on our Friday lunches and I found this gem on Yelp. First thought when I entered was there are a good amount of Asian customers in here. Authenticity established. We were seated immediately even though the restaurant was pretty full. The staff was nice but it was a very rushed hello, come sit here, and set the menus on our table. I typically don't expect great customer service from any Asian restaurant. My only request is that my table is clean and I consume delicious food. 

What we ordered:

Seafood pho with glass noodle (#22?) - the broth was on point! Everything else you can't really screw up. They delivered the sauce in a dish with the full bottles. We asked to split everything so they brought extra bowls and a ladle. I was excited about the ladle because I never got a ladle to split my meal. I felt a little giddy :) 

Grilled pork with imperial rolls over vermicelli - solid!! The meat was juicy and tender and full of flavor. Everything else you can't screw up. It came with a container of chili sauce on the side and fish sauce Perfect. I love chili sauce in my fish sauce stirred up. Try it. 

I also want to point out that there was a cucumber slice in our water. Freakin impressed and first time ever at a Vietnamese restaurant. Loved it! 

Overall, great food/ menu and friendly staff. I plan to come back to explore the rest of the menu. They even have bun bo hue and bun rieu, my favorite authentic home style dishes. Brownie points!
author: Jeanne L.

description: This restaurant is in the harrier part of SoMa with homeless people loitering around, but the inside is very clean. The Pho is one of the best in the city being very clean and containing a good amount of noodles, protein and garnish. When I want Pho in SoMa this is my go-to place.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Really large menu of Vietnamese food and do all the dishes decently, but service is slow. One time I and another party of one were seated at the same time, but the server brought her a menu and not one for me... I waited 7 minutes before just going up to the counter and grabbing a menu myself.


---- NOODLE SOUPS ----

Chicken Pho: 4 stars

Pork and Shrimp Wonton with Egg Noodle (Hoanh thanh mi): 3 stars
Standard or above average for a Vietnamese wonton noodles, but they just have this additional sweetness to the soup broth that my Chinese palate can't shake... it's crab or shrimp base I think.

Bun Ga Rau Cai:  4 stars
Chicken and vegetable soup, but it comes with seafood-based soup by default with that aftertaste I didn't like.

Bun Dau Hu Rau Cai: 4.5 stars
I got this vegetarian noodle soup with chicken broth and it was the perfect thing for a recovering sore throat. The tofu is soft and not fried, and it comes with broccoli zucchini carrots.


---- ENTREES ----

Bun Cha Ha Noi:  4.5 stars
Huge portion of pork, noodles and vegetables in a fancy looking dish with BBQ pork slices in sweet sauce.

Dau Hu Cari: 5 stars
Golden-fried soft tofu cubes, onion, broccoli, bak choy, zucchini and glass noodles in coconut curry. Outstanding.



Gotta come back to try the spring rolls!
author: Letitia L.

description:
Mmm, their pho is amazing! Very flavorful, I love how the meat comes a bit raw. Prices are decent for what it is as well! 
The staff barely speaks English and the place looks pretty sketchy when you come in, but don't you fear, the food is worth it. 
One time I even came at lunch with a group of 10 people, and after convincing them for a couple of minutes, out of nowhere, in a place absolutely full of people, they came up with a table and chairs. Unbelievable.
author: Luba Y.

description:
Pho. Always served hot, fast and the noddles perfectly cooked upon arrival. 

Oh how I love you Pho. After traveling to Vietnam miss Saigon's has become my favorite place to sneak off for filet mignon pho. Heavy on the Thai basil and the flavors are clear, bright and savory. 

I really can't get enough of their pho. I'd try more of the menu but I tend not to stray.  I do have to say everything on the menu looks fairly tempting, one day I'll deviate. 

The service is always extremely fast and attentive. I've had a few mishaps where they took vacation and no one was there, but outside of that I'm always pleased with my experience. 

Great for lunch service in the Fidi or SoMa area on week days and they even have fairly late hours on weekends for a SoMa location.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Came in here for lunch due to the rave reviews - the interior is significantly better than the exterior, so don't be fooled.  

I got the #27, Bun Bo Hue, and shared a #1,the fresh shrimp spring rolls.  With the spring rolls came avocado sauce (didn't know this existed in Vietnamese cuisine) and peanut sauce, both delicious compliments to the fresh vegetables and noodles in the spring roll. The pho was tasty but oily. Good amount of meat, noodles were a good texture, and the broth was spicy and good, but I didn't want to eat it all because of the top layer of oil. Overall enjoyable meal with the slight deduction.  

And, I will definitely come back for the avocado smoothie!
author: Ben K.

description:
Decent option for Vietnamese food
Bun bo hue and vermicilli were both above average
Good service
author: Jones T.

description: I'll make it quick, not a bad dinner spot. My gripe was that the tofu and eggplant used those huge eggplants instead of the thin eggplants, making the dish very bitter and seedy. I'll keep it at a three since Miss SaiGon offers a nice selection of vegetarian fake meat dishes. Everyone else in my group enjoyed their meals.
author: Heather F.

description:
This is by far the best bowl of pho I've ever had. The meat was plentiful and very high quality. (And the brisket in the combination pho is amazing). The broth is rich and savory. The noodles are not over cooked. The large sized bowl was so huge I couldn't finish it (but I won't be getting the small size because it looks significantly smaller)

The appetizers (freshly fried veggie egg rolls and juicy fried tofu with green onions) were surprisingly also knockouts. Also, the Vietnamese coffee! Oh my god, so good  

I will be back to try other items on the menu.
author: Diane W.

description: Great food, super affordable! The neighbourhood is pretty sketchy, so I don't recommend walking to the restaurant.
author: Ryan R.

description:
My favorite pho place in SF! & super close to my house so that doesn't hurt :)
I recommend ordering a side of beef broth (amazing for hangovers, not gonna lie!

Also, delicious crab rangoons and sandwiches!
author: Shelby H.

description:
Bun Bo Hue for me please. That's what I always order at Miss SaiGon. It appears that some people have been complaining about the lack of pork blood in the BBH. I believe they offer that option now since I was there last night after a Yelp event. They asked if I wanted the "classic version" with everything in it and I said yes. The BBH included pork blood cubes, pork cake, slices of pork bones, and slices of beef. You get the traditional long noodles here, not the thin Pho noodles. It also had lime wedges, jalapenos, mint, basil, and slices of cabbage on the side. I asked for extra sate and they delivered. I believe they are one of the very few restaurants in San Francisco that will give you this delicious condiment. I have never been to Vietnam but I think this dish is pretty close to the real deal.

Miss SaiGon has a very interesting decor, especially the mannequin dress in traditional Vietnamese clothing at the front door. I believe she is Miss SaiGon. The restaurant has white table cloths and cloth napkins. Overall it's very clean and well kept.

The area is quite sketchy at night. I suggest that you go with a friend unless you're a burly man or woman that can fed for yourself. It's perfectly fine during the day but I'd stay away in the wee hours of the night if I were you. 

They accept credit cards and their service is top notch. The waiters are friendly and nice to everyone. I think that is enough for me to keep coming back... Yes, they get my stamp of approval.
author: Tim G.

description: Terrible.  Bad food (I've tried a LOT of Vietnamese including in Vietnam and this was really bad).  Awful service as if it was the first time they met actual customers. Rough neighborhood. Not a place you want to be at night if you don't have to. Why this is 4 stars HAS to be a mistake or someone is cheating on yelp.
author: World T.

description:
Because tu lan is packed

on the way back to the car, full of disappointment, we pass by this place. On the outs, it looks almost like a mortuary, with dim fluorescent lighting. Our stomachs were growling, we were hangry, and had no patience to wait for Tu Lan. On a whim, we went into Miss Saigon. It was kind of creepy, because they have a life size mannequin dressed as Miss Saigon who greets you at the door. 

Anyways, once seated, we consulted yelp, phew what a relief. The food is there comparable to the vietnamese food you can find in san jose. it was full of various ingredients, the broth was full of flavor, everything was delicious! Will definitely be back.
author: Long C.

description: I really didn't like the food.  I ordered eggplant with chicken.  The chicken was like rubber and the sauce really didn't have any flavor.  I only had a couple bites and could not eat anymore.  The waitress asked me if I wanted to take it to go and I said that I didn't like it.  I was kind of surprised that they didn't offer to take it off or get me something else.  That would have been a way to keep a customer.  My friend who was with me also didn't like the soup that he got.  Perhaps it was what we ordered.  I had been there in the past and it was good.  Anyhow, I won't go back.
author: Paul A.

description: The spicy chicken wings and crab spring rolls are the only things I get here and they are so delicious trust me try it. I have tried lots of other things on the menu but those are they two items I prefer.
author: Rita A.

description: Typical Vietnamese restaurant. LOTS of items to choose from their menu. Affordable prices. Good sized portion. I can't remember what my dish was called but it was a vegetarian noodle soup. Really delicious and filling. Perfect spot for a quick meal.
author: Danielle V.

description:
Get ready for a weird ride. This place is a trip. How so? It's a combination of many components: the random decor of flower center pieces (many of them), rock metal music, animal figurines, Christmas lights, Fresh Prince of Bel Air song remix, some sort of promo recording of a Halloween store and of course the Miss Saigon mannequin that greets you at the entrance. It's real entertaining, even more so on holidays. 

Despite the oddness of the place, the staff is super nice and the food extremely delicious. We came here on a Saturday around 2 pm and there was a steady flow of people coming in and out until we left. I'd definitely come back, maybe not with a hangover the next time though. Overworks the hungover mind to fathom everything that's going on.
author: Joanna H.

description:
They're the only pho place near Union square that I know takes reservations.

Called in and made reservations for a group of 8 during the lunch rush and they were able to accommodate us. The food can take a bit to come after ordering so if you're in a rush, I'd try pre-ordering if you make a ressie.

The pho is very satisfying and decently priced for downtown. (~$7 for a regular size) I think it's better than Pho 2000. They even offer visual entertainment and by that I mean playing movies on flat screen TVs. Last time, they had Avatar on with Vietnamese subtitles. 
PWN.
author: Kat C.

description:
Not in an ideal part of town if you are going at night.

Many more tourists than locals when I went.

Several large TV's showing concert footage, that for me hurt more than helped the ambience.

The items I ordered were OK, but not particularly special.

1. Goi Cuon - Spring Rolls - fish sauce too mild;

7. Won Ton Soup - Pork and Shrimp dumplings - Great broth loaded with scallions and crispy fried shallots. Unfortunately the won tons were disappointing, there was a strong ham taste that I was not fond of.

27. Bun Bo Hue  - Spicy Pork with vermicelli noodle - This was one of the better items. Great broth. 

32. Bun thit nuong ch gio - Vermicelli with grilled pork, egg roll, lettuce, cucumber, sprouts - fish sauce too mild
author: David T.

description: Stopped in here for a sandwich right before getting on the Bart. I got the 5 spice chicken bahn mi. Pretty tasty for $5.  They have like 5-6 different bahn mi to choose from.  They used a sauce which tasted like creamy pate. Yumm.
author: Dan O.

description:
I love the food here. I've visited 4 times over the course of several months and have always had wonderfully fresh, delicious food. The fact that I can order through Postmates is an added bonus (particularly when you're off sick and really want pho but can't make it any further than your front door). 

I am concerned by their low food health rating. These scores can be determined by a number of factors, and though I've never had a bad experience, it would be good to see if they've made progress on improving things. They run such a popular business, it would be hard to see why they wouldn't take steps to address any issues.
author: Nina N.

description: Solid spot. I've tried many things on the menu and the dishes are consistently good for the price point, which is affordable.
author: Will O.

description: I am a regular at Turtle Tower in soma area but it was Sunday so Turtle Tower was closed. That's how I stumbled upon this place. It was def good and great value. I can't say this will replace my regular pho joint (simply bec Turtle Tower is so close) but it is a solid option #2! Also, better pho sides (like sauces, sprouts etc)
author: Anisa M.

description:
I ordered the small Pho Tai for delivery using Eat24 tonight. At first, I was hesitant about doing delivery since the broth needs to be hot. I was also unsure about how the food would taste because I know what good pho tastes like.

When I opened the bag, the broth was still steaming hot! I dunked my noodles, beef slices, sauces and other sides into the same container and let everything sit for about 5 minutes so the noodles can break apart and soften. Then, I took a sip of the broth and it tasted wonderful - very rich, flavorful and most importantly, it was not at all oily. The meat was good too, and there was plenty of beansprouts, jalapenos and garnishes. A size small was more than enough for me, even though I was super hungry. 

You know you've had good pho when you feel *energized* by your meal rather than weighed down. I will keep ordering from this place for sure! 

(Eat24 charged $4.99 for SOMA delivery and allowed tip in the app. Food arrived in ~30 minutes though it really depends on where you live and how busy they are. Check their blog for coupon codes before you order!)
author: Melody Y.

description:
Health inspection 54 out of 100? Yikes! Well, I haven't been there since 2014 so this review is a bit old. It was my favorite non-bahn mi Vietnamese restaurant. The neighborhood is dodgy. In fact, it's probably the crappiest street in downtown. I've never had a problem, but I suggest you stay alert.

The interior is so tacky. Once you enter you'll be greeted by a caucasian mannequin under a nón lá (conical hat) and dressed in a faux-Vietnamese dress. Like I said, tacky but me so hungry.

The pho is to die for and their bi cuon is the best I've ever had. Service is quick and friendly. If you can get past the health inspection and the nastiness of the neighborhood, I highly recommend this place.
author: John T.

description:
Food is awesome. When I lived in SF a couple blocks away from this place I'd go every week. My boyfriend and I usually get the beef curry and JUMBO PRAWNS GARLIC NOODLES. They are the best jumbo prawns garlic noodles I've ever had in my life: slightly sweet, chewy, garlic noodles with crunchy bits (not sure what they are but they make the noodles amazing). Fresh, crispy prawns. Awesome flavor.

Staff is super nice and helpful; they always have smiles on their faces. They recognize my boyfriend and I now since we go so often. So sweet!

I've eaten here countless times, and have NEVER gotten food poisoning.
author: Ly M.

description: Finally brought the cash to try this place out! I've heard from locals that this is the place to go to for some legit hole-in-the-wall pho! Today a quick pho-fix was much needed and this definitely hit the spot! I got #19 - pho with rare beef and beef balls. I wish I had told them to put the rare beef on the side because I didn't find much in my pho :( But the soup base was really good! I added in about 4-seconds of sriracha, but other than that, it was great! Reviews say that the service is bad but the people that helped us today was really nice and the food came pretty fast. One con though - it was SUPER hot and stuffy inside but otherwise, definitely going to go back to try other things on the menu!
author: Linda K.

description: Came here for another week of #phomondays by recommendation of my coworkers. I ordered the filet mignon noodle soup (pho) and it was fantastic! It had a great beefy flavor and the meat was so so tender and delicious. I easily slurped it up. I'd give this place a solid 4.25 and will surely be coming back for more!
author: Rehana K.

description: I'm infuriated with Miss Saigon.  My girlfriend and I ordered two meals for delivery on Aug 30, 2015.  The restaurant was sold out of one item - the primary item we wanted and the reason we picked the restaurant - and didn't bother to tell us!  The delivery man showed up to our home - late - and simply said "we are out of Bahn Mi, so we didn't charge you for that."  no, that is not okay.  And what awful business acumen.  If they had called, I'd have substituted for another dish, which probably would have been more expensive anyway.  Instead, they keep us waiting - and past the expected delivery time - and only deliver half the food.
author: Greg B.

description: Food was great but space was weird. They put us in a basement and they played a Disney movie on the TV.
author: Lindsay L.

description: We love this place! We just had #32, #27. Too much deliciousness! Dessert #106 is highly recommended.
author: Adela P.

description:
Great beef noodle soup pho. I haven't tried anything else (just beef filet mignon, make sure you get the one with the filet), but it's really good.

Their secret is in the broth, it's so strong and beefy and isn't watered down, you can taste the entire cow in the salty broth, yum!

It has two floors, so you can always find a seat, even on busy weekday lunches.

Also, they have Eat24 delivery, which makes ordering any Vietnamese food for pickup/delivery easy.

Staff is also really nice.
author: Chuck N.

description: Solid, cheap, quick lunch place. Good food, good spot. Their pho and rice plates are definitely both tasty.
author: Aaron A.

description:
LIFE CHANGING. 

That is, life chaning for a pho noob.. but, based on my dinner company (experienced pho eaters) this place is good all around. Super deliciously fresh, flavorful and fragrant pho. 

Took advice from Foursquare and ordered 17b -- the filet mignon pho (large obvs) and imperial rolls as starters. Everything was delicious - but you probably don't need the starters. Just dive into the pho. 

Go Go Go Go Go Go Go Go Go
author: Andrea D.

description:
Don't chicken out.

Because if you miss ordering the chicken breast banh mi you'll miss perhaps the best chicken sandwich ever. 

Myself and my dining companion were in awe over the rich flavor and healthy texture. It was either grilled or poached. It was definitely delicious.

Served in a huge roll with all the traditional Vietnamese fixings. Passed on the mayo and jalapenos and added plum sauce instead. This is a really good move.

Five spice chicken sandwich was good too but when compared to the chicken breast runs a distance second. Not as healthy. Not as delicious.

Service was prompt but the order did take a while. Good thing we found ourselves so enamored with the sandwiches we ate quickly. 

Don't be chicken.
author: Jason B.

description:
Really good Pho here!  I am a big pho fan and this place does it right.  The large is 10 dollars and is pretty much a whole meal, it is HUGE.  It is only a dollar more than the small so definitely worth it.  My friend got a chicken salad and my wife got the spring rolls.  Those were just average.  Yes I stole some of their food, as I always do.

In conclusion, if you want a place to get really good Vietnamese pho for fairly cheap come here.  It is worth going out of your way for.  It is a great way to warm in a cool San Francisco  breeze.  The other food is decent, but i wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Michael P.

description: Average chicken pho. Okay beef pho. Skimpy sandwiches. Above average prices, like $1-2 more than other Vietnamese restaurants, compared to Chinatown and Tenderloin. Food still tastes good, but I didn't get what I pay for. Nothing special here except the mannequin.
author: James L.

description:
I feel like in the downtown area it's hard to find a lot of good restaurants.

My friend and I came in thinking pho would be a great quick bite.  I saw on yelp the reviews here were pretty decent.

I noticed that there was only one person taking order and many of the other works did not speak english well if not at all.

Yet, with their great customer service they got us out there in 30 mins!  Thanks so much staff of Miss Saigon!  

The only drawback would be that I had to flag them down many times, but they were super nice and attentive.

The pho itself was pretty decent, I usually get the chicken pho.
author: Michelle T.

description: Best pho in San Fransisco by far, and I know what I'm saying because I've tried pretty much every Vietnamese restaurant in the city. I'm also half-Vietnamese and I've learned the taste of a real pho. The price is also really affordable, so if you need to eat a delicious pho for a good price, you know where to come!
author: Nicolas G.

description: Service was quick and great. Food was delicious. I have the say the chicken pho broth was a little different from what I am use to! Although, it was different I still liked it! Kinda fancy looking inside!
author: Thuy N.

description:
The past times I've eaten at Miss SaiGon were during dinner hours. One of the little details I like about Miss SaiGon is their beautiful, handmade, scrapbook-like menus. I don't know if it's because of dinner hours, therefore more people and shortage of the prettier menus, but they hand out their boring, printed version of the menus instead (but with pictures, at least).

Anyway, on to the food. I've tried some noodle bowls and entrees since my first visit. The pho ga (chicken soup with rice noodle) had a very generous amount of green onion, white and dark chicken shreds, and good-textured noodles. However, the chicken broth was extremely bland.

The pho dac biet (combo beef with rice noodle) comes with filet mignon, rare steak slices, beef balls, and tripe. The meat slices were good, not too chewy, but the meatballs were lacking, especially because they're sliced into thin sections so it looks like there's more. The beef broth lacked a bit of flavor, unfortunately.

The tiger prawns with garlic noodle is a small portion for the price paid (about $17). The noodles have a small hint of garlic, and overall didn't cut it for me. They just weren't garlicky enough. However, the star of this entree is the tiger prawns! They're huge, fresh, and covered in a crispy, delicious batter that's sweet and salty. The entree also comes with a small dish of garlic salt and pepper with lime.

The service is still very friendly and attentive. However, food from Miss SaiGon doesn't come out as quickly as they do at other Viet restaurants.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Sunday. The day that I forgot that everything closes early, including a lot of food places around the main hub of SoMa. Instead of heading back east, I decided to continue on westward, and ended up in a bad part of town. Luckily for me, my friend saved the day and took me here, because I didn't know what else to eat.

I have to say, this place is pretty legit. The price is a bit high (granted, I'm too spoiled with the plentiful cheap food in LA), yet they deliver on authenticity. From my experience, the broth is the key to any pho dish, and Miss SaiGon had it down. Everything else on the pho special was pretty good, though I did wish I had more mint 

The server was so nice to my friend and me that after our bill, we got a bowl of che. I haven't seen this kind of gesture in a long time, and I'm pretty glad that I was able to end my trip to SF with this place.
author: Tom T.

description: I went back for more!! I can now officially give them five stars!! Yes my favorite Vietnamese so far. Everything is so ckean tasting, I am not super thirsty after eating, so probably no msg. I had the bun riu today and it was so good. I ate my friend's pork meat patty and grilled pork dish. There was a side of pickeled vegetables that was very good. All GOOD!!
author: Karen T.

description: This is one of our favorite Vietnamese restaurants in town. We order here often during working lunches.  They have the best canh chua ca loc and their garlic noodle with shaking beef is super. We order here often on a regular basis if we cannot make it to the restaurant.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Food = good.  Big menu. We were here for a birthday dinner, so we tried a bit of everything--rolls, salad, curries, noodles, etc. 

Service = good

Prices = moderate.
author: Fannie S.

description: According to my son..a true supertaster.. the pho here was the best soup (not the best pho.. the best SOUP) he has ever had.
author: Sam V.

description:
Ah, the good old number 17 at Miss SaiGon. The filet mignon pho here is the absolute TRUTH. I started working on this list looking for local pho that would top Miss SaiGon's, but in the end, I went back, and it's still the best in SF. This is some real filet mignon right here too. We're not talkin' thin slices; we're talkin' chunks and lots of 'em. The veggies are always crisp, and the pho is always consistent. Mission Street and 6th Street isn't the greatest corner in town, but once you walk through the glass doors into this Vietnamese food heaven, it's an ultimate Asian comfort-food experience. It's always busy, and the owners are pleasant people. It's a great place for groups. Make sure to start with the spring rolls and crab rangoons!

Read more THE 11 BEST BOWLS OF PHO IN SAN FRANCISCO
http://www.thebolditalic.com/articles/6564-the-11-best-bowls-of-pho-in-san-francisco
author: Dai N.

description:
Miss Saigon is in one sketch ass part of SF. I'm never on foot in this area so I didn't try it until this year. 
I've done take out only but Miss Saigon fares well.

I've only done the bun bo hue per my friend's recommendation. Thank goodness I have found a decent BBH within take out distance! Miss Saigon's BBH hits the spot each time. They give you plenty of meat, cabbage, sprouts, etc. Just need them to put more of the sate when you do take out and I would be a total happy camper.

I haven't ever had pork blood in my BBH from here (booo!) but I read on a recent Yelp review that they have this option now?? They should update their online menu system so I can have this! 

P.S. Look out for the mannequin in the doorway, it's creepy as hell...especially when you're in the middle of taking off your helmet and it's the first thing you see.
author: Susy C.

description:
Out of the couple of times I've been here I always got the beef pho. It's the best I've ever had. Slices melt in your mouth etc etc.

The desserts are pretty good too. I like the taro smoothie.

Everything else about the menu is solid, no complaints. Only drawback to this place is the relatively drab interior.
author: Andrew G.

description: Wow this was a amazing bowl of pho! The restaurant decor is very Vietnamese and very clean. It does have this kinda strange mannequin in the front (kinda amusing and she is well dressed). The bowl of pho with everything inside was amazing and the service was pretty quick for the lunch rush. Would definitely return again! Next time I would like to try their sandwiches.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I loved it!
