One thing to try is the salmon dinner plate, served with garlic noodles.  This is as good as anything served at the Slanted Door, where it would be twice the price.  Everything here compares well with Bodega Bistro, one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco, although the style is quite different.

The downside is the neighborhood.  Some of the sights and smells on the street make you wonder about the place a few doors down selling hot dogs.  You don't walk out and take that leisurely stroll down the street to Muni, you move quickly and don't look around.  It's better at lunchtime, but it's still not a great location.  The location probably does help to keep the prices down.

Update - Two more lunch visits and a dinner visit, this place is just as good as the first time.  Also, forgot to mention the water is served with a cucumber slice in it, very refreshing.
author: Spike S.

description: Came here for a big family dinner with 10 people.  The restaurant offered an extensive and almost overwhelming menu with pictures that looked like a scrap book.  Loved the choices and ordered the tomato based pho with crab meat, which I've never seen offered in any other Vietnamese restaurant.  Super tasty and an entertaining waiter.  For a party of 10, he took all our orders without writing a single thing down, and we all got our food as ordered :)
author: Nicole P.

description:
There aren't too many pho places in San Francisco, so miss saigon is a good place to go for you pho cravings. They give you large amounts of food for the prices you pay.  

The only downside about this restaurant is that it's located off of 6th street.
author: Pauline B.

description: Without a doubt, this is the best Vietnamese (and particularly Pho) in the area. I don't think I'd say it's anything to write home about, but the BBQ pork is hella tasty, and for $8, it's certainly one of the cheaper lunches in the area.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Yes, I know it's in a shady neighborhood and across the street from an adult shop.  But if you can look beyond all that and walk in, you'll be pleasantly surprised. The service is not in your face but attentive, food is tasty and the price is just right.  Unlike most Vietnamese restaurants, this place is clean and modern.  

I ordered the bun dish of noodles & chicken, its probably one of the best I've ever had. Prior to coming here I was just tolerant of Vietnamese food but now I'm a fan.
author: Brian H.

description:
Excellent find. Was on my way to lunch to take friend to my fave Vietnamese place Mission-7 when we happened on Miss Saigon. Friendly service, clean space, super fresh ingredients. Have had two types of pho that were light fresh and delicious. Have gone for dinner twice as well. Their stir fried calamari is the best ever. More like a dry fried it's subtly sweet and salty tangy and savory. The carmelized garlic is addictive!

Fried tofu in tamarind sauce is another top dish. 

My only disappointment is they've been out of the Thai green iced tea I've wanted to try. Prices are great too; $23 for two people.
author: Jon L.

description: Food and service were great. I ate there twice in a week.
author: Jon R.

description: I love this place, I come here for the Pho. Area a little sketchy, place is clean. I recommend this place.
author: S F.

description:
this is my favorite restaurant. seriously. the best foooooood. 

so three reasons to try miss saigon. 

1. you are greeted by a effin mannequin at the door with a "miss saigon" sash. i think the place is named after her. 

2. the food is amazing. try the bo luc lac, or the curry tofu. for apps try the wonton soup. 

3. the service is amazing. seriously. amazing. i read some reviews that don't speak highly of the service, the service is wonderful, attentive and courteous. the let me park my bike inside cause its the shadying neighborhood in sf. that is freaking service.


eat here. its amazeballs.
author: allen j.

description:
Clean clear pho's are the winner for me here.  Clean and bright, which makes wife happy, and an outpost of sanity on the otherwise shaky world of 6th and mission.

Wife had spring rolls, very simple and good.

Iced Jasmine tea, a reasonable tab, and a solid lunch in an area where not much else is available.  Try walking down 5th or 7th and then down mission, the run from Market to Mission on 6th can be rough.
author: Jules K.

description: MS is an oasis on this stretch of 6th street.  if you're looking for a clean vietnamese place to dine at, look no further.   the standout dishes were their homemade kimchi, and the catfish cooked in a claypot!
author: Sheri N.

description:
OK, first of all it's really close to my place, so that's definitely a huge plus! The restaurant is nice and clean, the staff is friendly and fast, the portions are huuuuge and delicious. Today we had an appetizer (fried squid with garlic and onions), a soup (beef won ton), two main courses and a desert for $31 :-) ...and if you're asking yourself, YES we needed a doggy bag...All in all, it's worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood (much better than most of the other choices on Market and Mission)

Suggestion: try the chicken with yellow curry and coconut....yummy!  

P.S. As others mentioned, their "entertainment" choices are a bit weird: first time they played something like The Divas in Concert (Celine Dion, Shakira, etc.), today there was some Chaplin videos...
author: Timea B.

description: I had always gotten take out from here - which is very easy and convenient - but I ate here for the first time recently.  It is as others have said - terrible neighborhood but nice and clean on the inside.  The papaya salad and chicken pho (with free range chicken, no less) are great, as are the spring rolls.  Service is efficient and friendly.
author: B. Y.

description: I have eaten here at least three times and I have always enjoyed it.  However, today I went for lunch and it blew me away--it was so delicous!  I started with the appetizer portion of their wonton soup.  It comes in a small bowl but it is deep and filled with lots of delicious dumplings.  The broth is light and so tasty.  I then had the beef in a garlic curry sauce.  Wow, it was so great.  I brought back some leftovers because the portions are huge, but I am so tempted to finish it right now!  Highly recommend this place; it's worth the walk down 6th Street.
author: Amy F.

description: The service is great & the people very friendly.  Inside the decor is nice; outside the neighborhood is seedy (if that's something that concerns you). I have friends who rate the restaurant as a recommendation, but, while I really wish my review could be positive, at best, their food is average.  I cannot speak to the Pho (I'm not a fan) but IMO every Vietnamese restaurant must have a drop dead delicious pork  & vermicelli noodle dish; theirs missed the mark.
author: Brian C.

description: Not bad for Vietnamese food in this area. Very conveniently located to our Pickwick Hotel, this place gave us what we needed, noodles. From pho to fried rice, us gals rolled out of this restaurant satisfied. Location is questionable so go during the day time. Restaurant is pretty immaculate.
author: Joy C.

description: Considering the seedy area this is a nice restaurant, with reasonable prices, great portions. Service is OK, and once lunch hits it fills up in here. I had The vermecelli noodles and I really like it. The spring rolls are delish! and the thai drinks are sooooooo yummy. The only thing I dislike is that SCARY MANNEQUIN they have once you enter the door, I wish they would get rid of it. It gives me the heeby geebies!
author: X X.

description: The food tastes home-made with very little additives. I reminds me of the yummy food that my mom makes every time I visit her in So. Cal. The atmosphere and the price are also great. I didn't expect to have such serene experience given the fact that it's at the corner of 6th and Mission. Happy dining!
author: Pauline N.

description:
Had dinner for the first time there the other night.

Service was great, it became a challenge to empty my water glass before they could fill it back up again.  My first positive impression was of the lemonade that I ordered.  It was obviously fresh squeezed, and made with real sugar.  As I drank it I was transported back to my grandmother's driveway, selling lemonade for 25 cents a cup.  

I ordered the grilled and shredded port plate, which also came with egg cake (and I opted for the fried egg on top of the grilled pork).  The grilled pork was yummy, with a delicious glaze and perfectly tender.  As I am not schooled in the ways of Vietnamese food, it would have been nice to know the shredded pork was served cold, and I didn't like the texture, but the rest of the dish, including the egg cake and the soft-fried egg over the grilled pork, was so good that I can't wait to go back and try something else.
author: Keith P.

description: Great pho, fantastic prices, and excellent service.  Everything you could want for a pho place!  The egg rolls are better than the spring, FYI.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I'd been anticipating the opening of this restaurant for a while and it was great to finally try it.  Amazingly enough, the restaurant is actually really good!  It's so good that I've been there twice in one week!  This is what we've ordered: papaya salad with beef jerky - a flavorful appetizer that's sweet/sour and slightly spicy, Korean BBQ ribs with garlic noodles - a bit hard to eat, but full of flavor and very filling, shaking beef - well-marinated, savory and tender beef chunks with onions and potatoes, fried Tilapia with fish sauce - I did have to add some salt to enhance the flavor a bit, but it was an incredible dish and they give you 2 whole fish!  It's good to see a decent restaurant in this neighborhood and it's great that the food is so high-quality.  The staff is very friendly and nice, which makes for a pleasant experience.  The ambiance is not fancy and this probably isn't a date spot, but if you're looking for a good casual place that isn't divey and serves great Vietnamese cuisine, then this is your spot!

PS - they don't always have this for dessert, but if you see the mango sticky rice, you have to get it - it's really amazing!  It's a generous portion of sweet and freshly sliced mangoes and slightly-sweetened rice topped with sweet coconut milk...what a way to end a meal!
author: Ken G.

description: I visited this restaraunt,equipped with Wifi,my favorite Vietnamese restaurant
author: Nicole R.

description:
After enjoying happy hour at a foodless establishment, the five of us decided to fill our tummy's and stumbled into this lovely place. I am definately a fan of this place. Why you ask? Well:

1) Cool cloud painted ceiling....it reminded a few of my friends of Vegas.

2) The staff is very polite, and their service is excellent.

3) The resturaunt is super clean.

4) The bathroom is super clean (they clean it many many times a day).

5) The portions and soups are too delicious (I recommend the chicken soup with rice noodles and their lemonade-Yummy).

6) My friend ordered their coconut juice. To our surprise, they brought over a fresh coconut with a straw and spoon from which you can sip yummy coconut juice and eat the coconut meat. She loved it!

If you have kids with you, be careful as towards where the bathroom is, there are stairs that lead down stairs. There aren't any saftey devices to ensure your young child will not fall down the stairs (looong stairs), so...for young ones 6 and younger....you may wish to walk them to the facilities-and not let them wander around. If you don't have kids, and have drunk friends instead, well...same goes for them! :-p

In short, with eye soothing colors splashed about the place, the clean/crips look and the excellent service; the atmosphere here is one that is welcoming.
author: Darrel D.

description: It was super clean for a pho place (and for its location), but nothing particularly stood out for me as incredible.
author: Jamie C.

description:
i don't know what i would do without some good, affordable viet food in the neighborhood! lunch specials are awesome.. i would recommend the beef vermicelli, it also comes free with soup and sometimes they even give you free red bean dessert. even if they don't give you the red bean dessert you should just get it b/c it's THAT good. thanks miss saigon for making 6th st a little more friendlier.

also, service is great. cucumber water taste amazing, and your cup never goes empty.
author: Justin W.

description:
This is a really great place to eat.  I don't know too much about Vietnamese food outside of Pho and Vietnamese sandwiches.  I've never though much of Tu Lan so this seemed like a good place to try.  My GF and I went on a Monday night so it wasn't very busy, but I've past in the day a bunch and it always looks pretty packed for lunch.  

We ordered the dinner for 2 special and we a bit overwhelmed.  There was sooooo much food, it would have best been shared by four people.  The spring rolls were great, the mint wasn't overpowering bad ingredients, which is nice.  The soup was just spicy enough to make me sweat, but still enjoy. They shrimp and noodle salad was amazing and I wish I could eat it all day.  For the main course they served up a grilled salmon with garlic that was fantastic.  I usually don't like salmon, so it has to be fucking tasty for me to put it in my mouth.  The "Vietnamese Omelet" thing was one of the most interesting things I've ever heard of and delicious as hell.  But my favorite was the Shaking Beef.  I'm drooling just thinking of it.

So do yourself a favor: check out Miss Saigon.  It's good, the price is right and 6th/Mission really isn't a bad neighborhood.  It's mostly just crack heads, and they don't want to hurt you, they just want to smoke crack.
author: Ian M.

description: I was kind of torn about this restaurant because I really loved some dishes but was overall disappointed by the pho.  I absolutely loved their crispy calamari.  I am actually craving it now!  We also had the spring rolls which were really refreshing because it was stuffed with lots of fresh veggies.  The pho was ginormous.  And the soup was amazingly good.  I was just disappointed by the beef and tendons.  Generally I like my beef very thin and lots of tendons and the beef was kind of overdone and not enough tendons and not the kind of tendons I like.  So kind of disappointed on that front, but I would go back and try it again or try the other dishes.  It is super cheap, so..
author: Li Y.

description: I don't work downtown, so I can't tell you how this place is on a regular basis.  However, when I bopped in during a convention for lunch, I have to say the service was _excellent_ and the food was tasty.  I highly recommend this place.  Except for the mannequin at the front of the restaurant.  It's kind of awesome in a random kind of way, but in a restaurant, it just looks weird.
author: Jim S.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I've been coming here for the past 1.5 years. It started with Pho (the hangover cure) but I've tried many other dishes and every single one has been delicious (spring rolls, fresh rolls, dry vermicilli, crab soup, etc) Clean, superb customer service, and great food! Can you ask for more? Well, if would be nice if it was in a better location....
author: Kwixxy S.

description: Solid pho ga. Open at 12pm on Saturdays, not 10:30. Very clean inside and quick service. Don't be scared that it is on the shadiest intersection of SF on 6th and Mission.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I had dinner at Miss SaiGon and for the most part it was an enjoyable experience. I agree that the restaurant is located in a 'sketchy' neighborhood. I was with a friend (male) and the smells (ewww), sights (random street people) and sounds (cursing, loud arguments) made for a disconcerting experience.

Sitting down within the restaurant was felt like finding an oasis in the desert. The atmosphere was very clean and bright. The Celine Dion DVD that was playing wasn't the greatest of lite rock selections but was fine. The staff provided helpful suggestions and was very friendly.

The food was decent. The spring rolls with peanut sauce were tasty. The pork and fried rolls over vermicelli was good but I found the noodles a bit soggy. I had an iced coffee and it was tasty but not particularly remarkable.

Miss SaiGon also had some dinner specials (buy 1 get 2nd half off) but we decided not to go for the entrees. I might go back at some point but think that I'll give some of SF's other Vietnamese restaurants a try.
author: Gil L.

description: If TuLan up the street is crowded, then you'll love this place!  I had the traditional Pho dac biet, and it was more flavorful than some other nearby restaurants I've been to.  They're not stingy on the meat either.  Other items that caught my eye were those delicious looking Crab Rangoons sitting at every table around us.  Is there something these people know that I don't?  I'll definitely try those next time I come.  The clientele isn't what you would expect of a 6th street location.  BTW, they've got LCD monitors surrounding the dining area and you'd be lucky if some opera DVD wasn't on repeat.  How about you leave it on ESPN for a change?
author: Michael B.

description:
I came here on a weekday night to grab some dinner with a friend and was very pleased. Trying to fight off a cold, I knew a big bowl of spicy pho would do the trick, but hadn't had any in SOMA before. The 3 1/2 stars on here at the time were enough for me to give it a try, and I'm glad I did.

While the neighborhood isn't the friendliest, I was able to find parking right outside, and by the time I sat down I nearly forgot about the 3 dudes outside who looked like they were going to urinate on my ride (but I took a seat by the window just incase).

For better or worse, this place doesn't have much character, but I'm not sure I'd expect that from this type of a restaurant. It's clean, the food is great, and the service is nothing to complain about. They also seem to have quite the collection of popular 60's and 70's tunes recorded in cheap karaoke/muzak style. Mixed into our conversation throughout dinner was a little Name That Tune as we were shouting out "Yesterday!" "You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin!" "Girl From Ipanema!"
author: C P.

description: Place is clean but the quality of ingredients are really poor. We ordered the beef and chicken pho. Both used really poor quality meat and the noodles are of the cheap variety. I also ordered the spring rolls and they forgot the pork. The service was good so I'm giving it an extra star.
author: Kato D.

description: Good Pho. Friendly service...and for some reason Pinocchio playing on all three tv's.
author: Atif Q.

description:
I would have given this place an additional star if it were in a better location. It's really just 2 blocks away from the Westfield Shopping Center, but oh my, what a difference...I went there for lunch in daylight and was still a bit spooked. 

The place was busy but not packed. I could have had a table if I wanted, but chose to order takeout instead. The staff is super friendly: took my order right away and gave me a glass of of water with a slice of cucumber to quench my thirst while I was waiting. I ordered #26, the crab noodle soup. It came bagged and ready to go in less than 5 minutes! 

I devoured the meal once I got back to the office. I was glad that they knew how to pack the noddles and soup so that it didn't spill and stayed hot. The soup had good flavor and the portion was generous. My tummy was satisfied. 

I'd go to Miss Saigon again if I'm in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to dine there.
author: Ava C.

description:
I actually think this is some of the best Vietnamese food in SOMA, or as it were the SOMA-LOIN. I think it is the best Vietnamese food outside of Little Saigon, Turtle Tower to be specific. If you think about it in SOMA there isn't a place that is open at night, that serves Vietnamese food where you can get a lot of food for 22 bucks. 

I had the shaking beef with the garlic noodles for the first time tonight and yes I was impressed. I have had a number of different dishes from this fine establishment and I am a regular. I have been a regular for about a year now. 

If you know anything about the immediate neighborhood where this place is located, then you will appreciate this story. This place is right smack in the middle of the SOMA-LOIN. The SOMA-LOIN is a very diverse and eclectic neighborhood. There are many entrepreneurs walking down the street. Some ask you for change, some ask you if you want a date (but a date means you have to have money) and some ask you if you would like to procure some crack rock. I would estimate that most in the neighborhood are self employed. 

My wife is a small Asian girl from Taipei, Taiwan, who moved here about 4 years ago. If you've been to Taiwan then you know that places like the SOMA-LOIN don't really exist there. 

Back to the story. It was the first time we ordered there for take out. Parking is a bitch in that neighborhood so I double parked and she ran in to pick up the food and pay. I guess we were a little bit early because the food wasn't ready yet. While she was waiting a couple of entrepreneurs, (the kind that ask men for "dates") walked in and asked to use the bathroom. The proprietor said "No. Bathrooms for customers only." The wonderful ladies shouted expletives and then proceeded to steal the jar of free candies, that are provided as an after dinner thank you for patrons, and ran off. Oh, and before they left they had enough class to return the candies by throwing them on the ground, they kept the jar though. 

Being from Taipei my wife was a little shocked, as this type of behavior is not really feasible in Taiwan. If you have been, then you know what I'm talking about. The proprietor gave my wife our food after all this happened and my wife said "Thank you. Do you deliver?" To which proprietor said "Yes, we will deliver for you." 

Now we are regulars. We have called since and asked for delivery but they always say they are too busy. They don't really deliver. I think the guy saw the expression on my wife's face after the above altercation and would have said anything at that time, for damage control. 

You gotta like that about a business like this. Taking a part of the city that for so many is home for the American nightmare, and turning their little corner into their own part of the American dream.
author: Anthony Y.

description: It used to be my favorite Vietnamese restaurant, but recently some how their food quality and quantity is going down.It was really hard to find a space on Miss Saigon around lunch time but not now. That's why I think they lost many customer.
author: Leon V.

description:
I thought this place was a pretty good Vietnamese restaurant. Overall, the food tasted pretty good and it wasn't very expensive. Also, I thought that the service was excellent. I guess the neighborhood could be considered a bit sketchy but I didn't find it to be too big of a deal.

I've tried the spring rolls, chicken pho and the vermicelli noodles with pork (bun thit nuong). I felt that they were all very tasty dishes. The spring rolls dipped in the peanut sauce tasted very fresh. The chicken in the chicken pho was tender and the broth was very smooth. The vermicelli noodles with pork was awesome as the entire dish was very refreshing. If you order the vermicelli noodles, be sure to use that fish sauce.
author: Jasper H.

description: best pho in SOMA! the spicy pho blew my mind - sooo good.  Super clean restaurant and quick, friendly service.  don't be turned off by the seedy corner/intersection it's on; walk through the door and the restaurant is usually packed.
author: Tara H.

description: Great food, horrible service and seating. Ambiance is crappy. I have to say the food is very, very good. A tad on the sweet side.
author: G J J.

description: My regular weekly food: summer roll and #29 soup, broth is delicious. The Vietnamese coffee will wake you up! And the young coconut juice is very fresh.
author: Anthony C.

description:
The restaurant is nice and clean, the service was excellent, but the food tasted horrible. 

The rice was dry, the meat burned and the vegetables far from fresh.
Despite this, we decided to try the banana cake for dessert. That was the biggest dissapointment that whole day. It was a, litterary spoken, grey and probably microwave heated square, which tasted as bad as it looked.
author: Malin A.

description: HOLLA!  CHING CHING!!!  I finally found my pho spot thanks to my co-worker.  The broth here is exactly how I remember my pho.  It was so good that I had to purchase an additional order to go.  Since then, I have gone several times, sometimes 2-3 times a week, and have basically tried their entire menu....ITS ALL GOOD!  My search for a Vietnamese restaurant ends here!
author: LIVE to E.

description:
I had the sliced pork with the vermicelli noodles a few weeks ago here. It's ok. Nothing special.

The imperial roll is comparable to the ones at 7th Mission. Just ok, nothing special.

Unlike Tu Lan.
author: Josh B.

description:
Walked in and the place looks pretty spacious and clean.  So, my hopes have been raised in anticipation of the meal I will soon have.  I ordered the pork with cold vermicelli noodles.  Unfortunately, the admiration stops at the point I put the rubber pork in my mouth.  :P
And yet when we walk out, the line is out the door.  (If I wasn't so nice I'd be tempted to yell, "save your appetite, it ain't worth it!")
author: Gina C.

description: Had the spring rolls, chicken satay and pho. MSG overload! Didn't realize until part way through. F-
author: G M.

description: You have to shuffle through a bunch of bums to get here but it is well worth it. I always get the Bun at Vietnamese restaurants. I am not original at all. I don't usually eat pork but with my Puerto Rican friend and my Jewish Boyfriend I have come to crave to oink. # 32 was good. The pork was delicious and everything else was exactly what I would expect in a bun We also got the summer rolls with roast pork an shrimp. Yum. My Bf and I were fighting over the sauce. He also got the bun but with beef. It was good but he really wanted my egg rolls. I am a good boyfriend but it wasn't easy as those egg rolls were so good. They were a little to skimpy with the meat and egg rolls though.  What really makes for the experience is the owners. This was our first time here but we felt like regulars. The waiter/ owner  went out of his way to make conversation with everyone.  There were 5 tables around us and he had something different to say to each and every one of them. He was so nice. The food here is really fresh and the service is wonderful. With that said I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The service is great but the food is standard fare.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Scenario: Craving Vietnamese food on the way to SOMA from Financial District.

Product: Whoa!  I ate the clay pot crispy rice seafood rice combo.  OMG!  It was so delicious.  The rice was cooked perfectly, seafood was delicious but best of all the mushrooms were to die for.  They were soft, juicy and flavored with some sort of delicious soy sauce teriyaki combo.  My friend had some seafood vegetable vermecelli and it was also good with well cooked noodles, a not too fishy fish sauce and properly cooked shrimp.

Service: Simply as good as it gets.  Really, almost too good.  Someone came by asking if we were pleased or needed more beer about every 5-10 minutes the entire time.  Food was served immediately after it was cooked and they bussed the table non-stop.

Atmosphere: You'd think for less than $10 a plate for most of the food that it would be your typical in and out Vietnamese resteraunt, or worse yet like the fast food slop bar farther up the street.  WRONG!  The atmosphere of the fancy decor, instrumental holiday music, flat panel TVs, and nicely dressed crowd made me think the plates should've been priced more around $20 per.

Uniquity: Swank atmosphere and insane service for an affordable price on good food.  Also, they give you a coupon for your next visit.  This place is all that and a bag of chips!
author: Robert R.

description: I love this place. I mean there is something about it that is a little cheesy with the musac and the water fall, but even with that you can play guess that toon. The food is delicious and the staff cares a lot. My favorite is the curry tofu with rice noodles. It's so good and I am not usually a vegetarian, but this is as good as meat.
author: Rachael H.

description: I recently went for lunch after hearing all the hype for years about this place. While I have nothing bad to say about the food or the service, it wasn't anything special as well. It seems like a regular Vietnamese place with good food, average service, I would be a bit more inclined to give it a higher rating but we were sat at a table by the window that a couple of crack heads on 6th street decided to camp out and lean up against, perhaps they could close the curtains so we don't have to have such a great view :) Like I said no complaints about the food or service but nothing out of this world either, I would rather go to a place that I don't have to worry about my car getting jacked or having to stare at homeless people and crack heads while I eat, thats just me though ;)
author: Bobby B.

description:
food is just ok - 3 star at most
cheap decoration, in a not very good neighborhood
will not go back
author: susan s.

description:
Food is great, service quick, and amazing beer selection.
Grade A in my book
author: Chuck D.

description:
Huge servings, definitely ate too much-  had the lemon pork with peppers it was very good.  And they had kim chi, traditionally Korean; I didn't care because it was, ooh soo gooood!

The environs looks like it is going to be expensive, but it is quite the opposite - very affordable.  Give it a shot!
author: Tiberius A.

description:
CHEK IT OUT!

Excellent everything.  I always over-order.   .   .
author: Clifford L.

description:
My girlfriend and I happened to be in the neighborhood at lunchtime on a Saturday. It was was cheap, and very clean. The service was good. The food? I liked the numerous vegetarian options, but nothing about it really stood out. I had cold Vermicelli noodles with tofu and vegetables, but I think it could have been more flavorful. The tofu was crispy, but almost too dry. In all, I would eat here again but wouldn't go out of my way (especially considering it is on 6th Street). 

One thing I forgot to mention- they were blaring a Brittney Spears comeback concert on all of the televisions in the place, at lunchtime on a Saturday. That could be a big plus or minus, depending on your preferences.
author: Mark H.

description: Nice, clean open atmosphere. Decent service. Ice water with cucumber served. Garlic noodles werent as good as PPQ's, but were still yummy. Amount of food served was a little less than expected for the price, but was tasty. Spicy shrimp in chili paste was very good. Also, you can always sub brown rice for white. Would return.
author: Julie S.

description: I've been here for the 1st time today.  I'm a fanatic viet food fan and can cook it pretty well myself so I get very excited everytime I run into a decent/good vietnamese restaurant, especially given that this is SF, not OC.  I ordered the rare beef & meatball pho.  The broth was quite good.  I wish the quality of the beef & meatballs can be better.  But overall, the pho wasn't disapointing at all.  The ice milk coffe was quite good.  I ordered a pork chop & egg cake rice for togo.  It was quite good as well.  The pork was well marinated and tendor.  The egg cake especially was very good, moist and very flavorful.  This is important to me since I think most restaurants tend to bomb the egg cake.  They have a very extensive menu so I'm impressed.  I'm planning to come back for other dishes soon
author: elle n.

description: One of the finest restaurants in the city.  The shaken beef with garlic noodle is excellently prepared - tender, slightly rare inside, brushed with a deep, flavorful Hoison-like sauce.  The TV's are turned very low, usually playing some manner of cgi animated show with midi pop soundtrack.  A waterfall, bamboo wall panelling.  Very calming.  The crab rangoon appetizer with spicy lemon dipping sauce is also fantastic, and the menu prices are way, way more than fair.  It make everything taste that much better in retrospect when the check arrives.  It is a little jarring to step back outside from a peaceful dinner into the howling aggression and bloody-bandaged sadness of 6th St.  afterwards, but it's most definitely worth it.
author: David E.

description:
This is a long story but indulge me, please. 

So in planning our trip to San Francisco from NC, I was desperately seeking Vietnamese food. Dave K., my SF Yelp friend, steered me in the direction of several seemingly good choices. If we had had more time, I'm sure we would have tried more than one of his suggestions. But we didn't, so I had to choose. Once I finally figured out where we'd be located and how mass transit works in SF, I decided on Miss SaiGon, the one closest to where Dave lives. (I was looking for you, D.)

Turns out, my idea for Vietnamese would happen with a group of 9 after our tour to Alcatraz on July 29. Two in the party (parents of our friends) were a bit nervous about it as they had seen plenty of greasy spoons in Chinatown and weren't up for that type of gastronomical experience. I tried to explain how different the cuisines were, but honestly, I had no idea if they would like it. 

We ended up hopping on a bus to get us closer to SOMA. That's when things got crazy. An older Asian woman on the bus saw me analyzing the map trying to figure out where we were going and asked if she could help (which was very nice of her I might add). I told her we wanted to go to Miss Saigon on 6th Street, between Minna and Mission. She said, "That's not a very good part of town." Well, Dave and the others warned me about the Tenderloin, but I've been in bad parts of town in DC, NY, London, Boston, Dallas and I wasn't all that worried. But the older couple overheard, and they WERE WORRIED. Terrified, is more like it. As we exited the bus and started walking toward the restaurant, they announced, "we aren't going, we'll meet you later." Then my friend (their daughter) got all upset and said, "I'll stay with you." Then her husband got ticked off and said, "No way, we're not separating, we're all eating together." But the older couple was pretty adamant that they weren't going to eat bad food in a bad area where people are killing each other and who knows what else. 

Well I don't know how it happened but next thing you know they decide they'll take a look and if it looks "OK" they will stay. And wouldn't you know, we arrived at Miss SaiGon and found a lovely, clean restaurant with waiters happy to serve us. Everyone stayed.

And I for one am glad they did. Not that I would have left, but the fact is EVERYONE was happy with the choice. Days later, the older couple kept telling me how good the food was and how funny it was that the lady on the bus didn't phase me because I was determined to get my food, blah, blah, blah.

Okay, so the review. The restaurant is tastefully decorated in a contemporary motif - I enjoyed the video on the wall of whales and dolphins. The wait staff was attentive and helpful - they seemed genuinely delighted to serve us. (Not like a place across from Oriental Pearl that I don't know the name of but it was a dump and the wait staff stood around us watching us eat and made us very uncomfortable.)

We had a green papaya salad that was DELICIOUS. My kids got spring rolls and they were fresh and tasty. The pho was very good, not the best I've ever had but it hit the spot. I had a delicious barbecue pork Bun. Everything was fresh and well presented. Someone had shaking beef and was so impressed he was talking about trying to recreate it at home. 

Oh, and as for the area, like I said, I know bad areas and this was not a bad area. Granted we were there before dark and left maybe before things go sour. I dunno. My husband, who was facing the door, said he saw a couple of guys smoke a doobie and saw a woman who looked like she was working the streets. Still, don't let that keep you away from good food.
author: Pamela D.

description:
I've eaten here three times now, and most likely won't be back - it's not a bad place, it's an okay place, but even in this neighborhood there's too many really good places.

The food is okay...but they can't seem to resist putting way too much sugar in the curries, which is mainly what I go to Vietnamese restaurants for. Service is friendly, and average to slow speed; I've been here three times and twice they got the bill mixed up. The decor is very pretty, I must admit, but overall I'll choose a place that has very good food , good service, and less pretty surroundings.
author: C P.

description: I think I ordered the wrong items (beef lemongrass vermicilli) but I wasn't impressed
author: Christopher L.

description: I would come back to grab some pho from Miss Saigon. It's pretty good, and the service was actually very good for Vietnamese food. The soup was fresh and the meat was good as well.
author: Stephen M.

description: Decent place to stop by and eat before POINT BREAK LIVE at the Metreon!!! Saturday night 730, a little over half full, the restaurant was bustling and hustling.  Tinkerbell the movie was on TV with subtitles, NICEEE.  I got the pork vermicelli bowl and shrimp spring rolls to start.  The rolls were mostly lettuce, not so exciting.  The bowl was good as usual, the pork pieces were fatty and chewy and could have been better.  The waiter served my friend the wrong beer- fail, but he also asked ahead of time about separate checks (we had like 8 ppl)- redeemed past fail.  Overall rating- decent.
author: Skye W.

description:
When I saw this in the SF Chronicle, I was excited to try it out but my first time will be my last time.  The service is good, the restaurant is nice but the food is not very good and it is definitely overpriced for the quality. 

$8.95 for a lunch special is not worth it.  I had the beef lunch special.  It was ok but nothing that would make me want to go there again.  The beef entree came with a serving of rice, 1 cream cheese wonton type of appetizer (I think it suppose to be crab).  

The shrimp lunch special did not seem fresh...frozen shrimp for $8.95.  I think I will hit the TL for lunch if I have an urge for Vietnamese cuisine.
author: Mike S.

description:
I live nearby. I'm used to the 6th St. circus.

I thoroughly enjoyed my food. The restaurant was clean. Service was excellent.

If you're already in the area and want to visit an oasis that's great for people watching I highly recommend it.
author: Ty L.

description: We recently ate there while on vacation in San Francisco.  The neighborhood is not great, so we were very happy when we walked in and it was very clean and friendly.  We had spring rolls, chicken Pho and beef Pho.  All we truly among the best we have ever had.  If I were ever in San Francisco again, I would make a point to come back.
author: Kim G.

description: I love this place WAY too much. As a vegan, I have to say that their vegetarian Pho is the only one I've ever had where the soup base didn't seem to be some afterthought -- it's seriously delicious! Vegetarian vermicelli noodles are great too! The price is right, at about 6.95 for both those dishes. It's in a "special" part of town, but I always take the time to walk by and admire that building with all the furniture welded on the outside that looks like people are throwing things out of the windows. Also, the proprietor is super sweet, and remembered me even on just my second visit.
author: Kendall M.

description: Good Pho, but pricier than you'd usually expect Pho to be. You wouldn't expect a decent-looking restaurant at the corner of 6th and Mission, but I live down the block and I'm happy to have this place as an option. A much more classier place than Tu Lan up the street.
author: Anthony W.

description: Their Bun Ba Hue (think I spelled it wrong)...is THE best in my opinion. Worth a try if you love moderately spicy beef soup with noodles (I think it's beef soup!)...hooked up with LOTS of meat also! GREAT to chow down if it's cold outside and if you're hungover. The owners are always so welcoming and charming as well. Will always be a regular!
author: Ree W.

description:
This is a great Vietnamese Restaurant
When you step inside, it's like a little oasis on that corner of sixth and mission.  The place is really beautiful inside, there's nice music but the place is not noisy and makes for a relaxing meal.

The staff is very friendly and the food is very good.  We especially love the won ton soup.

Definitely worth a visit!
author: M. E. F.

description: Pho is great.  Ambiance and Karaoke tvs are amazing... Terminator video segments played behind 80s pop... And titanic video
author: J R.

description: My family and I came here for my sisters grad dinner, and YUM, YUM, YUM!! This place was so yummy. The price was definitely decent and the man who serviced us was amazing! He made the best effort to accommodate every ones request and had a pleasant attitude about it. The neighborhood is not the best, but hey, worth chilling in the hood for some good Pad Thai.
author: Ree A.

description: An unassuming gem w/ corner location in a sketchy neighborhood, but nothing could keep me from my 1st love...FOOD!  Walk in & your transported to another world.  Clean, welcoming, and fast.  Sit down, open up the photo album menu and let your eyes dictate to your stomach what's about to happen...order the Shaken Beef - tasty, tender, God it shook my nerves!  Shrimp in hot chili paste sauce...mmmm my glands are tingling as I think about it.  The bok choy in that dish perfectly cooked, shrimp succulent, take your rice and let the sauce make love to it.
author: D C.

description: I really like this restaurant!  Maybe it isn't the most authentic vietnamese restaurant but it sure meets my list for a vietnamese food guru.  I intern around the area of this place so I frequent here often and its very convenient especially when I'm on a 30 minute lunch!  This place never ceases to fail my hungry tummy!!  I usually have a small bowl of wonton soup and spring rolls but I have also tried the butter garlic noodles, papaya saladand pho all really great choices.  The lunch plates are huuge and look way to filling that I might go into a food coma at work lol but it sure does look good!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
this place is a few blocks down from the recording studio i am normally at when in san francisco .. all i can say is its great, affordable, flavor full and is a true representation of straight up Vietnamese cuisine..
the block its located on is a little seedy but also entertaining to gaze upon..
or some reason every time i am  there they have no music on and are blaring k.b.s world on the t.v. which is a Korean religious channel ??
anyway love this place
author: j c.

description:
bun bo hue is good here
pho is good
the rice dishes is super good (pork chop rice dish) make sure u add an egg!!
author: Cindy L.

description: It was another cold, damp summer day in SF, so we went back to Miss Saigon to enjoyed some nice hot pho.  I had the the pork and shrimp wonton soup for less than $7.  I liked the broth since it was flavorful without being too oily like a lot of other places.
author: Vivek P.

description: I keep going there thinking that maybe the staff would be nice but they never are. I order my food and I look at them directly and say thank you but they treat me cold. I guess they only like white people.
author: Alex P.

description:
Very good food, very good service.

I highly recommend asking for their Chicken Pho with dark meat only. It's really good.

Their beef and spicy beef pho's are pretty standard - Not too amazing, not too bad either.

Price is a little steep for Pho, but it is a nice restaurant.
author: P J.

description:
I've been going to this restaurant ever since it opened a few years ago and finally decided to sit down and write a review.  This place is very good.  I've never left feeling anything but satisfied.  There tends to be a bit of a line a lunchtime, but once you get a table you'll find the staff is very efficient and the food choices are abundant.  My personal favorites are the egg and shrimp, the garlic noodles and the crab rangoon, but the Pho is popular as are other traditional Vietnamese dishes.

The owner, Chi, is at the restaurant all the time and is very gracious and welcoming.  The staff really make you feel at home.  Don't be turned off by the reviews that trash the neighborhood.  It's really not that bad.  And, in any case, the environment inside Miss Saigon is very pleasant.

Keep up the great work, Miss Saigon!
author: Mike G.

description: I come here frequently since it is just down the street from me. I am always greeted very cordially. Since I have been there a few times they immediately ask me if I am going to have my usual spring rolls and Item #29 (a vermicelli noodle soup). The service is usually very quick and the food delicious. The price is definately one of the best deals in the city.
author: Mike L.

description:
I have been to this place once a week for the last 6 weeks. It is on the outer extreme distance of the comfortable to walk to radius from my office, but I eagerly make the 20+ minute walk without hesitation.

Everything I have tried here is really good, and ample portions. I've never left hungry, and have trouble stopping myself from eating too much.

I have two complaints about this place:
1. I don't like when places upcharge for brown rice, and they do that here. Why? Seriously. You're already making a big profit on the white rice, and brown rice is no more expensive. It makes me feel gouged. But I want the healthier alternative, so I take the punishment.

2. The horrible music. They play some kind of muzak or something that is hideous. And they have Asian soap operas on the TV a lot of the time. Both detract from the atmosphere, and I'd prefer silence.

My ratings:
Service: 4/5
Cleanliness: 4/5
Atmosphere: 3/5
Menu selection: 4/5
Food quality: 4/5
Food quantity: 4/5
Value: 4/5
Takes AMEX: Not sure.
Parking:Not good, as it is on the corner of Minna and 6th near Mission.  Watch out for the local street denizens who can be a bit aggressive and not so nice. They can be entertaining to watch if you have a window seat...
author: Bruce B.

description: I love this place, the surrounding area may seem a little sketchy but Miss Saigon is a safe haven with amazing food, nice people, and a peaceful ambiance.  I have had a number of dishes at this restaurant and have never once had a bad expierience. My favorite dish is the Spicy Golden Tofu, the tofu is crispy on the outside and soft in the inside, done to perfection. I recommend this place to everyone I know, i love spreading the word about Miss Saigon because for the price you really get a 5 star meal. Please check them out, oh and beers are only 3.50 a piece.
author: nathan r.

description: The anti-Tu Lan.  Love it a lot, very courteous service.  Water glass with a cucumber slice is sooo refreshings.  And I have counted over eight various paint colors in play on their many-shaded walls.  I am thinking that all the staff members went to the paint store and got to pick their favorite color.  Either that or one person just could not make up their mind.  Seriously though I am not gonna dis the decor because I like the lady paintings.  Also, the food is very good -- lately I'm a fan of ordering a side of the chicken broth with whatever else I get, be it goi con or bun or whatevs.  The broth is rich and golden and comes thoughfully garnished with fresh green onion, fried shallot and just a touch of cilantro.  Delicious.  Normally I would not rate a joint on broth alone, but I do find myself craving the stuff and will make a special trip out of my way for it.
author: Molasses C.

description: This place was good! The service was super nice and friendly, and they seemed to bring the food fast. The only issue was when my friend ordered a boba drink and they were out of taro flavour! What? That can happen?? Oh well.. he got something else instead and said it was a little bit weak, but it was otherwise good.
author: Reese W.

description:
This place is not great like this people rave about. So I wasn't feeling too well and I was craving for some beef stew with noodles for lunch. I happened to come across their menu at the http://eat24hour.com. I decided to submit an order and entered a pick up time at 2:10pm. The place is 10 mins walking distance and when I got to the place, I told them I'm picking up an order (gave them my name) lady just gave me a bag of food and say thank you. I almost walked away with the food and realize I have not paid and the food was too small for a soup. I turned back and made sure it was my food that Im taking with me and of course pay them since I entered on the computer I was paying cash.

I told them this isn't my food and I haven't  paid yet. Now for some odd reason they keep asking me if I called them which I told her repeatedly I ordered online. I was starting to get annoying with the lady who keeps insisting that I called. I told the lady one last time I ordered my food online and I was picking up a beef stew.  Lady turned around and look in the pile of online orders that was in the sink ( I don't know why they would have their online orders on the sink....weird). Now the lady told me it wasn't ready and it will take a minute for them to make. I told them fine, but I was not to happy to be waiting since my order should have been ready.  I waited 10-15 min and which this is why I like ordering things before coming to a place when I'm on lunch. My whole order was $8 including tax and she decided to charge me $8 with another tax on top of it. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? DIDNT HAVE MY FOOD READY AND NOW YOUR OVER CHARGING ME?? Im not mad the fact she double tax me, its more like the princple of having my food ready and for me to enjoy my lunch.  I would not be ordering food from this place again.  My food was not even GOOD like what this people been raving ABOUT. I would give them 1 star, 1 star for their cloud ceiling!!!!!
author: Marie V.

description:
You know you're becoming a local when you stop believing the eternal line about certain neighborhoods being "on the verge of change".  They've been saying that about 6th St since the day I moved here, and it still looks the same to me.  In fact, the only nabes that seem to change are the nice family-friendly, middle-class (for San Francisco, anyway) areas that grow ever more upscale--hello, West Noe (er, Portal).  Anyway, just a heads up that the aesthetically sensitive might want to approach this place via Mission St.

Once you're here, you'll find an improbably bright and clean interior, with improbably cheery, eager-to-please employees.  They're also going for broke price-wise--with the exception of the dinner specials, the numbers on the menu look very 5 years ago.  In short, they're doing everything they can to draw business in spite of the surroundings, and judging by the full tables, they're succeeding.  Of course, a true foodie will follow a good meal to the gates of...well, certainly a much worse place than 6th St.  The important question is, how's the food?  Aside from the Thai Iced Tea (serves me right for ordering it in a Vietnamese place), not bad at all, from the surprisingly large "pancake" appetizer (more omelet-like than the Korean variety) to the clay pot of sweetly succulent catfish.  I'll have to come back for the pho and dinner specials to truly judge it, though.  Hopefully they survive here long enough.  But who knows, maybe this block really is on the verge of change...maybe it could even become Little Little Saigon?
author: Wes M.

description: Food was alright. But it took forever to come. I mean, I'm not gonna wait 30 minutes for pad thai and chow mein. We were also in a bit of a hurry.
author: Kevin S.

description:
3.5 stars - 

warning about location - its in a janky neighborhood and we always park our car in a spot where we can see it from our table.

this place is solid: its VERY clean, prices are reasonable, and the staff are incredibly attentive and nice. 

-we always order the crunchy eggrolls (cha gio), the beef pho, and I personally love the minced crab in tomato soup base with vermicelli noodles (bun rieu). looks like they have a pretty extensive menu, ill be back to try more.
author: Jessica C.

description: I love coming here because of the friendly service and the food is a great bargain! The two of us leave stuffed for ~$25 every time.  I love the "bun" the best (vermicelli noodles with meat and veggies) but most everything I've tried is tasty :)
author: Grace M.

description: The place is clean, the food is fresh and tasty, the servers are attentive and friendly, the price is right. One of my favorite places for Vietnamese food. It's not perfect, but reasonably consistent. A great everyday casual dining restaurant. I eat here often.
author: Indy B.

description: Found this place out of desperation for some Pho in the area via Yelp and it paid off!  This place was great.  if i'm back in the neighborhood, I'm definitely coming back!
author: Pascal K.

description: Solid lunch spot.  I appreciated all the selections, especially vegetarian options.  Perfectly fine ambiance - crowded but I like places where there isn't a deafening din.  I appreciated the reasonable prices as well.  My vermicelli and tofu was just OK - nothing to write home about, though generously proportioned.  My friend loved her tofu and veggie dish, though.  Only weird part was the ridiculous large pieces of floppy bok choi - way too big and unwieldly for chopsticks or forks.  Overall, though, I'd go back if I were in the area - cheaper than Out the Door and reportedly cleaner than Tu Lan.
author: Gloria B.

description: I went here for lunch with a friend and ordered the lemongrass pork chops. The chops were slightly thinner than I am used to. The food was tasty. The seating was nice and makes you forget what really lies outside. Staff was great and charming. Clean place. So far I would go again but would need to have a variety of dishes so figure out the place as a whole.
author: Louis T.

description: Ate here with my sister, godson, and niece after the movies two Sundays ago. Good portions and good food. Grew-up in SOMA. Still ghetto as ever, but a lot more ghetto when I lived there. I remember this place was a  bar and it was a dingy pink. I had the vermicelli with stir-fried chicken ( I think it was called that). It was good, but it seemed a little bland even with th sauce. The sauce was a little bland too. I also had the Thai Iced Tea. Huge size...at least more than what I'm used to. My godson couldn't even finished his. My sister had the Green Tea Thai Iced Tea. That was yummy too, but seemed more a like a shake or smoothie. To be honest, I've had better Vietnamse food and a lot more cheaper. Overall, the food was good.
author: Neni E.

description: The prices are cheap. The food tastes fresh and light. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Overall, it's a great value. Plus if you need crack, it's conveniently located.
author: Matt W.

description: Minus the fact that the neighborhood is terrifying (I can say that because I'm a pioneer and I live there), this place is a total gem.  The food is absolutely outstanding and it's at a price point that can't be beat.  I've even grown so accustomed to the creepy statue in the front of the restaurant that I say good morning to it when I walk downtown to my office everyday.  Stop by if you're in the hood.  Also, stop by even if you're not in the hood (just park somewhere safe).
author: Dale R.

description: Miss SaiGon is yet another data point in favor of an inverse correlation between prettiness and tastiness at Vietnamese restaurants. It's a very clean and nice place, surprising for the location on 6th and Mission, and the staff is very friendly. The menu is pretty comprehensive and I was really excited that they serve seafood egg noodle soup. Unfortunately the food is average at best and the iced coffee was really disappointing. It was almost as thin and weak as your typical machine drip! So sad =(
author: Will A.

description: Phenomenal pho, one of my favorite things on a rainy day.  Other dishes look decent too but unless the pho gets worse I can't see myself trying them.
author: Karthik K.

description: Amazing food and service.  Try the vermicelli bowls topped with chicken or pork and eggroll. Then add some peanut sauce and hot sauce and enjoy.  For a refreshing drink try the Mango smoothie with tapioca.  Price for 2 with appetizer and drinks ( non- alcoholic) was $31!!! Amazing.
author: R M.

description: This is a bi-weekly stop on the take-out list for us.  We haven't ventured too far out from the basics, but the food is pretty good.  They always seem to have a decent dinner crowd there, which supports my view of this place being pretty good.  We typically get the fresh spring rolls, fried spring rolls, vermicelli or rice with grilled pork.  Generous portions which we usually can't finish.
author: Rod C.

description: love this place when craving shaking beef. I have tried their other food but always come back and order this. the place is nice and clean inside and makes you forget about the outside. While not dangerous ( during the daytime at least) it's not visually appealing. My co-workers and I go here about two -three times a month.
author: joseph c.

description: This place was definitely yummy! I had a combo pho with shrimp, imitation crab and chicken and wow! I was so stuffed. I appreciated the quick service and smiles and how they dont bombard you with the check before you are ready to go. This place was so yummy, I just wish it weren't in such a horrific location! :( I knew SF was rough in parts but sheesh!
author: Gina H.

description: I went here for lunch and ordered standard Pho Tai. Service was quick, they weren't packed, and the staff was friendly. I guess I've just set a high bar for pho; this certainly wasn't bad, but wasn't really anything worth writing home about (... as I write this). Good place to stop by for lunch on a work day.
author: Adam D.

description:
I LOVED IT! 

i ordered a beef curry rice plate and it was so GOOD! it's clean with great service! i would dine again!
author: Amy T.

description: Love the bun dish with pork, especially with a bowl of their clear broth.  This is a regular lunch spot for me and for lots of others in the area.  Keep up the good work!
author: Linda Y.

description:
I had a wonderful experience dining at Miss Saigon recently.  The first thing you notice is how clean the tables are, then the tall high ceiling, nice soothing music and the server(owner?) helping us with a big smile. We felt totally welcomed.  On top of that you can kinda see the kitchen, at least you can see what goes into your food.
My family all enjoyed their dish; except me, I had to change to a different dish that I ended up cleaning the plate.  They tend to not use breast white chicken meat, but dark meat, I think it is a cultural preference. 

I really like the little details, such water comes with cucumber, the menu has dried flowers underneath photo album. One of the soup comes with 3 quail eggs, not one. All the attention to detail made me fell for this place.  I only tried two dishes. Papaya salad comes with nice tofu. A bit sweet, you can ask them to make it less sweet. I had the soup with quail eggs, asked them to take out pork, and substitute tofu. They offered me more shrimp, I settle for more tofu as I was not craving so much meat. 

I will go back to try more.  A really warm inviting place to hang out with friends and family in the middle of 6th and mission.

*Warning, 
Avoid 6th street if you can, day or night.
author: A Z.

description: I live really close to this place and first let me tell you how I love that its helping keep that corner of 6th street clean.  Yes it is not a pretty corner but its not dangerous at all.  Just an ugly corner of SF.  So don't let the area scare you away.  The food is incredible and so are the fresh fruit smoothies.  You will not be disappointed.  You will leave full and very happy.  Take out is also available and they even serve you water with fresh cut cucumber while you wait.  The staff is very friendly and give you time to decide what you want.  No pushy waiter here.  Nice traditional programing on the tvs playing live music.  Really nice place.  Again don't let the fact that its on 6th st. scare you away. Give this place a try.
author: Jacob A.

description: The search for great pho is over!  Delicious Spring Rolls and Rare Beef Pho is what I had for lunch today.  The Spring Rolls were so filling that I only put a dent into my pho!  Excellent lunch, great atmosphere, and very clean!  I even got to watch Kung Fu Panda!  I may go back for dinner tonight!
author: Megan R.

description:
I really wanted to try this place after reading all the reviews, but it disappointed me today. I walked in at 11:50am right before it got crowded. There were three of the 2-seat tables available, but the lady told me to wait for 5~10 minutes because they were expecting people with reservations. So I sat myself at the counter and browsed the menu. When people started rolling in, they put two of the tables together to sit a 4-person group, and then 10 minutes later, they sat a guy at the remaining  table. Up to this point it was fine because I was assuming that they all "reserved" the tables. However, when one table opened up, they sat a couple that came in later than I did. Realizing this too late, and not wanting to go up to the already-seated customers and ask them to move, I decided to leave. They did take my order 10 minutes into my walk-in, but half an hour has already past at the point of my walk-out. And the food wasn't ready for me either.

To sum up: very clean, servers polite upfront, seems popular. But I did not appreciate how they ran their business. Need to do a better job organizing the waiting customers. They did motivate me to walk over to Latte Express on 5th and get a Vietnamese sandwich instead, and sign up for a Yelp account.
author: Inbae L.

description: With SOMA being our new digs, we needed to find a new spot that is inexpensive to chow down in. A short walk on over, we found Miss Saigon. Awesome. Awesome. Awesome. On a chilly Wednesday night, we found the place unpacked. The service was attentive and sooo very on it. The food was absolutely delicious! A 22 ounce rib eye with garlic noodles and chicken salad for $22? AND, the rib eye being amazingly delicious and tender? A nice pipping hot bowl of chicken pho to warm up our soul too? Kudos Miss Saigon, kudos! *** They gots tapioca! ***
author: Christina Y.

description: Very solid little restaurant.  Definitely not in the best location but for a day time visit not so bad.  I love when the husband has the company car, he will swoop by and pick me up and then we venture out to the Mission mainly but today he took a wrong turn.  We drove by Miss Saigon and I quickly yelped it, the reviews sold me.  We parked (not too difficult) and entered.  Super friendly service and very attentive.  We were blown away by the prices, nothing really over $10.  We went with the spring rolls, pho and buhn.  Everything was fresh, hot and tasty.  Oh and beware of the thai iced tea, this thing is honkin, it took two of us to drink one.  We will definitely be back, we love this place!
author: La C.

description:
I only give 1 star or 5 stars.  Otherwise, not worth my time to review something.  I'm not a Yelp junkie.  In fact, I'm pretty skeptical of Yelp.  

My first time at Miss Saigon was near its opening.  Lots of whiners were in there that day as some of the orders were wrong and they hadn't quite found the right rhythm for taking orders and serving food.  I thought it was ok but I didn't go again for months.

I went back tonight just to give it another shot.  The service was good.  Much better than last time.  I ordered summer rolls and Pho.  Both were really good.  I actually like their Pho better than Tu Lan.  Am I a Vietnamese food connoisseur?  No.  Do I know what tastes good for me?  I think.  It was good.  The brisket was damn good.  That's all I have to say.

Except... I live on 6th St.  I'm not intimidated by the thugs or the mucus on the streets.  If you're a wuss from the Presidio or something, you might want to take the hood into consideration.  Around here, they eat pieces of shit like you for breakfast.

And they do eat pieces of shit for breakfast.  I've seen it.
author: a e.

description: This place is OK. I work on folsom and 7th so this place is a jaunt through and up nasty 6th street (think of urine smells every step of the way) and homeless persons glore....its really the only decent pho place in the area and once you are INSIDE its very clean and spacious. Your standard viet place, nothing special, decent portions and prices. Good serivce. I dont know if I would brave the hike again tho!
author: Petri Y.

description: Eh. It's ok. The pork bun is a little boring. Service is kind of slow, and the noodles are not always fresh cooked, and can be a bit rubbery. The interior is nice, though, considering the neighborhood. If you are too wussy to handle Tu Lan, this would probably be a good option for you, but if you want really good pork bun, I'd suck it up and walk the extra block instead.
author: Tom H.

description: Definitely one of my favourite places to eat in the neighbourhood. Super cheap and delicious food. I usually get the pho or bun, beef for both and they are absolutely delicious. The portion sizes are huge and I usually order the small pho. There's a creepy mannequin that greets you at the front door which still weirds me out even though I've been there about 7 times since moving to SF about two months ago. The best is the totally random videos they play on their TV screens which range from Vietnamese showtime-type music performances to Celine Dion specials to insect mating practices a la national geographics..not kidding. Saw bee sex for the first time while slurping down some pho..err...
author: Sheena S.

description:
Ate here last night after driving past a few times and seeing the grand opening sign. Shamefully admit that I frequent shady 6th street and we were looking for a cleaner alternative to Tu Lan. Score!

Tasty food - I had the vietnamese pancake (which they graciously made vegetarian - super accommodating!) and the veggie bun. My bf had the pork bun and enjoyed his as well. Good flavors and not too heavy. Prices are extremely reasonable, and they gave a free jelly in coconut milk dessert to boot. 

Super-attentive staff who even refilled the water frequently! Clean and spacious inside. Extra points for the entertainment value of the awful muzak piped inside. We played "wait, which exact bad 80's duet is this?" all night long. Which would be even better if they had their liquor license...
author: C M.

description:
THE BEST PHO IN A LONG TIME.
I'm a pho lover and the broth was awesome. I didn't have to put much of anything inside the soup. The price was good for the bowl too 6.95 isn't bad compared to the terrible bowls I've gotten for $8 in and out of frisco.

Spring rolls were stuffed with real stuff not salad like other places tend to. this is pretty authentic I recommend this highly to anyone in frisco. Make the time to stop here.
author: Percia T.

description: #3 dinner special (shrimp with garlic noodles) is the bomb. Also tried the chicken pho and although the ingredients were all very fresh, it did lack oomph as a previous reviewer mentioned. The service here is great--very friendly and attentive wait staff.
author: Maria K.

description: Friendly attentive staff, yummy food, big portions and super duper cute inside-what's not to like?  I especially like watching the er...ummm...COLORFUL crowd outside the window at 6th and Mission.
author: Jason G.

description: I ordered the Crab Rangoon and a "rare beef & beef ball pho."  The rangoon had too much cream cheese, but it was pretty tasty especially with the sauce that comes with it.  The pho on the other hand was not so good.  The broth was bland (and very light in color, running pretty clear), and the "rare beef" was tough and super well done when it reached me.  Not that the pho was really bad, but it is definitely not high on my list.  I would much rather go to pho hoa tien in the tenderloin.
author: H. L.

description: This was a pleasant surprise. We were going to a show nearby so popped in for lunch not expecting much at all. Very clean and updated appearance. Good service although it was not crowded at all. Pretty full menu besides just pho. My favorite dish was the fried tofu with vegetables and coconut curry.
author: Benson W.

description: how can so many vietnamese restaurants all be equally delicious and healthy tasting! yay - love it!
author: Ben B.

description: Wow... Nuff said...........Definitely no outdoor seating though=)
author: Christian H.

description: I totally love Miss Saigon restaurant!  I went to Miss Saigon for the first time on 10.20.08 despite of bad reviews from my Vietnamese friends.  The experience really confirms that VIETNAMESE PEOPLE ALWAYS COMPLAIN, NO MATTER WHAT!  You have to come to restaurant to see for yourself!  I really enjoyed my food at Miss Saigon.  The papaya salad with dried beef was excellent and authentic.  My broken rice dish with barbecued pork, shredded pork and egg cake was so delicious.  I will definitely come back and highly recommend the restaurant to all my friends.  Despite the location, the interior of the restaurant is the charming, clean and sweet with relaxing and nice decors.  The service is very attentive and sweet.  The price is totally affordable.  The tableware is so beautiful and elegant.  You can take your date here every day!
author: Sunny H.

description: awesome pho and super great wait staff. not the cheapest in town but the ambiance justifies the extra price. it's still super affordable. i had the pho ga and the fresh rolls, both excellent :)
author: Letty E.

description: I really wanted this place to be good because it is close to my house and I am always craving a big bowl of pho.  While the staff is super nice here, the bowl of pho was small and the broth was just so-so.  I also ordered the Vietnamese crepe, and it lacked both flavor and it was not crispy - who wants a soggy crepe???
author: Dana H.

description: Totally delicious. Had the #25 (spicy beef pho) and the shrimp & pork pancake. Clean, excellent service, very reasonably priced (even for 6th street). It's hard to discuss Vietnamese on 6th without thinking of Tu Lan, but this place is clean and much more refined. Will go back.
author: David Y.

description: My husband and I started eating here about a month or so ago and wow is it good. It's reasonably priced and has a very attentive staff. Last night we ordered a filet mignon dish that was absolutely delicious, and for lunch specials we always get pho and it's always great. One thing that we keep coming back for over and over and over: they have the BEST coconut smoothies in the world. Seriously. If you order it, first you get a glass of the coconut juice, and then you get the coconut meat in a separate glass, all blended into a smoothie. You can then drink them separately, or drink the coconut meat one and then slowly pour in the juice to mix them together. Either way, you get a whole coconut every time! Soooo good!
author: Miriam W.

description: I've been here many times with my friends and family. They all liked it for the most part. Clean and cute place, nice and attentive staff, many options on the menu. the food tastes fresh and nicely seasoned. there isn't too much oil or gooky stuff. i love the fake chicken dish, though it is inconsistent sometimes. the bubble fruit drinks are also delicious and refreshing. anyways, this place is worth giving a try!
author: Rahul D.

description: Had lunch here today. It was very interesting to wait in line on 6th street and to people watch the sidewalk.  There were only sirens once outside and no one seemed to mind. They were packed (think a review just came out) and yet the service was kind and polite. The food was WAY more than I could eat and good. Crab rangoon was very cream cheesy. My compatriots loved the pho.  We will certainly come here again someday- when it's not an hour and a half for lunch.
author: B S.

description: Clean interior (esp, compared to the people lurking about outside), good food, affordable prices and close to my new digs.  Only complaint: - not enough meat in their pho.
author: Ming L.

description: I come here so often that the wait staff knows my name and my order. I have only good things to say about this place like it's priced well, has excellent pho and spring rolls, not a big vegetarian selection though, there quick to seat you, constantly re-filling your cucumber lemon water, and quick to give you your check.
author: Katie B.

description:
3rd visit to Miss Saigon on a business lunch (memorial day countdown).  We eat Viet all the time, mostly in the South Bay at local Pho places, on the weekends at "Kevins Noodle House, 1/2 block off of 19th avenue on Irving" and sometimes for fancy Viet-fusion.  Trying to get as much in as possible before a first trip to Vietnam this December 2009.  
One of my offices is 5th & Mission so it's an "interesting" walk up Mission to land at Miss Saigon, but worth the trip.
Miss Saigon is a great lunch spot, with above average service, amenities and really good quality. The seafood pho I had today was much higher quality than our usual haunts.  My friend had a repeat lunch special, which looked like beef sirloin, crunch won-ton types and noodles, that came with a side soup.  We also shared the shrimp rolls (fresh, not fried) which were great.
ROI is good, about $8-10 for standard lunch. 
Will keep this on the list for lunch spots and it has risen in the queue now.
author: Nancy N.

description: I am not even exaggerating when I say that my recent lunch here was the foulest I've eaten in a long time.  I got veggies and tofu.  The veggies were so freezer burned that the zuchinni was transparent and slimy, and the broccoli florets looked like melted plastic.  The tofu was cooked in rancid oil, I kid you not.  I was on lunch from work and needed fuel, so I dosed it up with hot sauce and lots of white rice and swallowed the tofu, but the veggies were just too gross to consume.  Never. Again.
author: Ben G.

description: My boyfriend talked about this place for weeks before I finally gave in and went.  I'm not gonna lie, I didn't expect much based on the location alone.  However, after walking in I was pleasantly surprised.  The space itself is bright and clean (did not expect that on 6th street).  It was also packed!  So far, so good.  I had a hard time deciding between #26 (noodle soup with tofu and vegetables) and #61 (golden tofu with eggplant in black bean sauce).  Since it was kind of a cold, dreary day I went with the soup.  My boyfriend went with #55 which he called "the best shit ever".. and it is indeed some pretty good shit.  My soup was good.. filling and pretty tasty but needed a lot of sriracha for more flavor.  I would definitely go back for the dish my boyfriend got though.  As a vegetarian I feel that I usually find a lot of tofu dishes bland but this one definitely stood out.  Very flavorful and the tofu was perfect.  The service was okay.  Not horrible but not the best.  Overall I was pretty satisfied and will definitely go back.
author: Kristin P.

description:
FIVE STARS only because there is no six star rating.  Have you ever been to a restaurant that is so great that all the others no longer seem so good.   Miss Saigon is that kind of restaurant.  

I've been to Vietnam many times and I've eaten at many Vietnamese restaurants in America.  This places beats them all.

First, the food is fresh.  Second, it's prepared with ingredients that you'd expect at a much more expensive restaurant, yet, somehow, they manage to keep their prices cheap.  Third, the portion sizes are large.  Forth, the staff is incredibly friendly.  Fourth, it's amazingly clean.  

One warning:  If you eat here, you're likely to become addicted to their food!  

Wow!  Wow!  Wow!
author: Mike N.

description: solid and authentic Vietnamese cuisine, very good pho
author: Nick F.

description:
decent prices and decent portions.  gotta order the crab rangoons.....deep fried cream cheese with imatation crab meat......very addictive...

everyone one the menu is pretty decent, but the pho comes in a very small bowl......no extra large bowls available
author: Moe S.

description:
I went to Miss SaiGon for the first time today for lunch.  I had their Beef Short Rib Lunch Special which was around $9. It included soup, 2 Crab Rangoons, Kim Chi, Rice, and 3 pieces of the Beef Short Ribs.  It was all very delicious.  

The soup is similar to the Thai's Tom Yum Soup.  The Crab Rangoon is made with Won Ton wrapper stuffed with Cream Cheese and Crab Meat then deep fried.  The Short Ribs were very tasty and was cooked just right.  It was not tough.  It also came with a dipping sauce made of  sweet vinegar and fish sauce.  For dessert I had their Flan which was also delicious and reasonably priced at $3. For drinks I ordered the Jasmine Ice Tea for $1.  

I will definitely be going back to try their Garlic Noodles and Shrimp stir fried in Butter, Garlic, and Eggs.    

Service was very good.  They made sure my water glass was full and they also refilled by Ice Tea.  They also wrapped the other 1/2 of my flan which I could not finish because I was stuffed.  

I have only have one little complaint and that was the soup was not as hot as I would have liked it.   Other customers may find the soup hot enough for them.
author: R H.

description:
I have gone to Miss Saigon for the pho several times since they opened and have never been disappointed.  They don't throw in the sliced beef too late, the serving is generous and fragrant, and it isn't 3/4 soggy noodles.  It's the perfect contrast to Tu Lan down the street if you want a refuge from the 'hood rather than the full-on greasy spoon flavored-experience.  

The cheesy music and beauty-pageant tv programs they play may not be your thing, but I've come to see it as a part of my pho experience.  If you want hipness and ambiance with your ethnic food, get the hell out of the civic center and say goodbye with your under $10-lunch experience.
author: Sonya G.

description:
i'm very happy there is a different type of food in soma instead of just pizza and the mall food.  i've had their pho bo vien #16, which was really delicious.  then on a different occasion i've had the ga xao khom #55 (which is a dish i reccomend for two, or if you're just really really hungry). my water glass was never empty, because everyone is always around with a pitcher of ice water.
