the staff is extremely nice and very accomodating (my table was kind of crooked so he fixed it until it went straight or offered us another table.)

plus! on both occasions.. we've been offered dessert to try because they are new.  yum!
author: gabrielle z.

description:
Great, tasty lunch. 

We ordered the fried squid appetizer,  which was excellent but slightly oily -- maybe the deep fryer needs to be turned up a bit?  But the spring roll/noodle/pork bowl,  one of my personal favorites elsewhere,  was quite tasty,  and the lemon pork was good too.  The chicken and vegetable soup had lots of nice-looking snow peas and zuchinni,  but got mixed reviews ("didn't taste like much").

Compared to Zesty a few blocks away,  this place is more upscale, the food is fresher, the portions are a bit smaller (actually a good thing in my mind) and the prices are about the same.  We'll be going here instead.
author: Will L.

description: Good food but very sketchy neighborhood.  You will have to transverse the maze of homeless, crackheads, dealers, dog poo and urine streams coming out of doorways.
author: Edmund W.

description:
Eating at Miss SaiGon is like going to eat at the zoo. If you are can make it past the different characters littering 6th and Mission, then you are in for a treat. Inside, the atmosphere is quite the oasis compared to the street life outside. The soft green tones on the walls and the waterfall makes it refreshing right from the start.
Even though they were busy for lunch, we had no trouble finding a table. We started with the pork spring rolls which were quite bountiful in their flavor and their freshness. The mint added the perfect touch to the spiciness of the tamarind sauce served on the side.
We followed that with the Pho Ga which is rice noodles with chunks of free range chicken. I have to admit the broth was way too plentiful, but the basil, bean sprouts, and the jalapeño peppers that come on the side made it more balanced and  fresh. The chicken was tender and the noodles were cooked just right.
The service was excellent and there was no worry about being rushed out of the place even though they were busy. When our bill came we were surprised at how affordable the whole experience was. We made it a point to try it for dinner. Ah, hopefully very soon...
author: Art C.

description:
so far i ahve only given this place one visit and can't wait to try it again. the place is super clean, as expected from any brand spankin new establishment, and the wait staff is super friendly. i chatted a little with them after placing my order and asked about business. they seemed very appreciative and after finding out i'm a soma local, not only gave me a discount on that order but send me along with a card for a 15 % discount next time! the food was good, and with customer service like that, i'm happy to support another great little local business! 
 
and people, please remember, slower service in some cultures is actually a good thing! not every culture is like us and insists on annoying and pestering you after every bite asking questions! god bless the vietnamese for leaving you alone while you eat, letting you take your time and allowing you finish on yer own damn time. if you need to eat in a rush, just inform them! but dont rate them poorly for cultural differences!
author: teala a.

description:
1 day me n my buddies have this growling stomach & we were thinking where to go & we're feelling to have asian taste..vietnamese would be nice, so we're planning to go out the door; but it's closed due to maintenance,then it happened that this pretty new vietnamese restaurant just opened. So we went there, were greeted by this very nice asian guy who served us with a sincere smile. So  there we were, i was pretty apprehensive because the area was pretty hectic & shady (6th+mission) st im not wrong...yees im sure now.
but this restaurant look clean & decent & it even has a couple of flatscreen tvs inside, so i tried not to judge the book by the cover even though it's around the shadiest line district. 
So when i was there, I was so hungry..................& i was craving vegies rice so there i ordered "Dau hu sot ca"
Golden tofu and assorted vegetables stir fried in tomato sauce, hey it's only $6.95, whoaa i thought very good for my thinning pocket :p 
oh before i ordered the food, i was craving for juicedrink, & they did make a very fresh juice for me by my request (carrot/orange) bcs i wasnt feeling that good that day so i have to eat healthy stuff. So the juice was fresh & nice, the staff was friendly & sincere, the place was very clean, now they're already gt 3 * so far...until the food came to me.
It was really surprising that the food i ordered was HELLA good!! The tomato sauce is actually taste sweet &sour, so nice, & it turned out that all my friends nibbled my dish & they said mine was the best! OhH that felt good!! :D
Now you see why u shoulndt judge the book by the cover, i've given them a credit for that & today i'll give them 4* for my smiling tummy & i was actually felt better that day.
Love Miss Saigon & I will definitely come back for it!
author: Ms C.

description:
good vietnamese food all around, especially the beef with pineapple and vegs stir fry, YUM!  although their Bun Rieu is not very authentic (they take away the shimp paste as a sell-out to a more American taste)
very clean inside, and amiable staff
author: binh l.

description: Vietnamese food is one of those cuisines that I have to eat when I crave it.  Walked 6 blocks for lunch after an intense pho craving (very few Vietnamese places in SOMA, even fewer got good reviews on yelp).  Ordered the pho ga, or Chicken pho, and it was really phenomenal, some of the better pho I've had.  The broth was incredibly flavorful and all of the ingedients were fresh- it felt like a healthy meal.  Also had the thai iced tea with tapioca- it was my first experience with tapioca balls, and it was really good!  A bit filling though, but really addictive.  Highly recommend this place, although it's worth noting it's in a pretty sketchy part of town.
author: Lindsey C.

description: This place is soooo good! My family and I went in a large group, and everyone loved their food. The service was great, iced coffee was perfect and it was *cheap.* The only thing I didn't love was the Carpenters playing on loop, but the yummy food helped me get past that.
author: Odessa P.

description: With the essential Tu Lan a mere block and a half away, my reasoning held, why bother with what will almost certainly be a sub par Vietnamese grub experience? There's nothing especially inviting about the storefront to suggest otherwise (in fact, the mannequin lurking just inside the door is straight up freaky), so despite living less than a hundred feet away, I'd never really given Miss SaiGon the chance until about a month ago. I was as pleasantly surprised by the food as I was horrified by the atmosphere of the place. The Pho was tasty, cheap, and plentiful, but eating at Miss SaiGon feels like being stuck in an avant garde installation piece;  a handful of flatscreens looped videos of fish as keyboard constructed bossa nova Elvis covers drifted eerily through the restaurant. It was like I had been trapped in a circle of hell that served damn decent Vietnamese food, a contradiction that I've yet to come to terms with after repeated visits.
author: Cooper B.

description: We hiked from the FiDi to 6th and Mission to see what Miss Saigon had to offer. We were welcomed with a friendly staff and what appeared to be a nice ambiance of cleanliness and open tables which meant we beat the lunch crowd (we arrived before noon). I ordered the #17 on the menu which is rice noodles with medium rare beef and beef balls. The medium rare beef was way overdone and not sure if I had asked for it on the side would have even made a difference. It was beef like jerky by the time my bowl arrived and thought that I had more noodles than meat. All in all, the soup was tasty but the meat could have been more plentiful and less noodles would have up my star-factor. There are other pho places in the FiDi that is much closer so I'm not sure if I would be willing to walk down here again. Oh, one more thing. By the time we were ready to go which was about 12:30pm, there was a line out the door so if you're coming, be sure to arrive early.
author: Karen R.

description: pretty effin cheap man, the pho was on hit and the service was great.  easily spend under $10 for lunch here.  de-lish!
author: Mimi X.

description: great oasis on 6th st. clean place, polite wait staff. food is great. and on 6th and mission!! used to go to tulan for years..food seems to taste better/fresher in a clean place. ;-)
author: shigeo n.

description:
my girlfriend and i went to Miss Saigon last night. we read good reviews so we went there to try out ourselves. i had very high hope---that was but my own fault. we ordered 3 dishes: pancake, spicy chicken wings and tilapia in fish sauce. 

pancake was a bit sloppy, plain flavor; chicken wings were dry, too sweet, not spicy, it came with very heavy sweet sticky rice, which could've been served as dessert, i was not sure why they served those 2 together, seemed like a weird combo to me since the flavor/taste did not compliment each other at all; the fish was decent size,deep fried, in a semi-clear sauce, a bit dry to my taste, and the sauce was just very bland. i had nothing to say about the food presentation either, since there were none. everything tasted lack of flavor and not even properly made.

during the whole meal we were fancying all the other good vietnamese restaurants we could/should have gone to. we also wondered whether we ordered the wrong dish? maybe if we ordered pho it'd been different, better? well, we were too disappointed to try another dish.  we vow to never go back, ever.

The service though, was friendly and attentive.
author: Echo C.

description: I stopped by on Saturday having heard really good things,  and wonderfully I was not disappointed.   Very attentive service, my iced tea glass was never empty.  The food was terrific,  the space clean and bright.  What a nice addition to the neighborhood.  The owner was recognized in today's (8.6) Examiner.  Congrats all around.  I will return again, and bring more friends along.
author: tom s.

description:
wonderful service, good food, and great ambiance.
will be coming back 8D
author: poing p.

description: Totally delicious. Had the #25 (spicy beef pho) and the shrimp & pork pancake. Clean, excellent service, very reasonably priced (even for 6th street). It's hard to discuss Vietnamese on 6th without thinking of Tu Lan, but this place is clean and much more refined. Will go back.
author: lilalaune12

description: I went for lunch and was disappointed.  I really wanted this place to be good since it's so close to work.  The atmosphere was nice enough--clean and more modern than a lot of the places on Larkin.  But the bun was overcooked to the point of being gummy, and the bbq-ed pork on top tasted more like teriyaki pork.  The imperial rolls on top were decent, but that's about it.
author: E L.

description: I love Miss Saigon. I tried it out after reading a review in the Chronicle. Everything I've eaten there has been terrific, and I've been back many times. I particularly like the shrimp curry, and the tofu with tamarind sauce. The portions are generous, very reasonably priced, and extremely tasty. It's very clean and bright, and the wait staff is terrific. They remember exactly what I like and how I like it cooked. Dinner tends to be a little quieter than lunch. So if you prefer a more relaxed lunchtime experience, just go a bit later, perhaps at 2 or 2:30.
author: Dana M.
